After I quickly fished it out (no pun intended), along with the roasted pork (which bf referred to as average tasting), I was left with a light broth, perfect, long chewy noodles, two pats of melting butter, corn, green onions & my favorite ramen topping--bamboo shoots. Delicious! The butter gave a familiar taste & a slight richness to the broth. Just the right amount of toppings & good ratio of noodles to broth. The flavors were just right. I'm definitely a fan!

The ebi spicy mayo was an excellent appetizer--half a dozen medium-sized fried & mayo-coated shrimp sitting on a cloud of crisp rice noodles. I love this dish everywhere I've had it; easily a winner. Bf ordered samurai wings which had an awesomely crunchy exterior. 

Check in on yelp for free edamame or chicken karaage.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I wasn't super impressed with Genki Ramen. We ordered the chasu ramen and chicken karaage. I thought that the broth wasn't very tasty and I was disappointed to see that the noodles were not fresh and looked/tasted like top ramen.

You do get a free appetizer if you check in on Yelp so if you do come here, you should get in on that! However, I think if I was ever in the area and wanted ramen, I would check out another place.
author: Alli Q.

description:
First off, I'm not for bashing on yelp and usually keep quiet if I have a negative experience. I've never given a lyft/uber driver under 5 stars... But this was really bad.

Horrible customer service. Waited 2.5 hours for delivery before finally canceling. Was a complete nightmare and ruined our night after just returning from a long flight. Called after an hour and 10 minutes (told 45 minutes expected) they said driver was already out... An hour and 15 minutes later (2.5 total) they still claimed it was still on its way. I asked to cancel and have the charge credited back to my card and they never delivered anything. The woman on the phone was rude and unsympathetic. I will never order from here again and will recommend nobody else does.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Got the Garlic Tenderous Ribs Ramen lunch set with Pork Cha-han (fried rice) plus the Kim Chi appetizer. "Tenderous"? I think they used the same menu writer as Ajisen.

With the kimchi they brought out a small complementary bowl of pickled veggies (cabbage, carrots, etc. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ml0zISgWDnt1hDWorSMNiw?select=Mv0EuRwlQU-XtVALUZCQ7g). I wondered what the kim chi appetizer would be. Just a bowl of kimchi (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ml0zISgWDnt1hDWorSMNiw?select=oBiK3dBJcKQKqxOq-jAOvQ). It was getting along in sourness. I liked it, but maybe time to add Kimchi Chigae to the menu!

The ramen was an OK bowl, but some issues. First off it seemed short on broth (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ml0zISgWDnt1hDWorSMNiw?select=oeqI5MZ__BFnjFFBc7q3ww) and being a conical bowl a little height at the top is a lot of volume. In the end I had a small pile of noodles in a smattering of broth. Never had that happen before.

Anyway, the tonkotsu broth had good flavor, but it could have been richer. Maybe this is better for maintaining my girlish figure?!? The straight thin noodles were slightly on the soft side (overcooked).

Toppings included half of a boiled egg, slices of roast garlic, spinach, the namesake tenderous ribs. The seasoned egg half was grey around the yolk and chalky (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ml0zISgWDnt1hDWorSMNiw?select=kvjcdfiTbC7lYeJmYl0c2A); plus was that it was seasoned. Wasn't a big fan of the roast garlic; it was very hard and didn't have much garlic flavor. The clump of spinach was forgetable as well.

The tenderous ribs were decent. I liked the flavor of the braised meat, but they could have been more tenderous ;-) Plus there was a large bone to meat ratio (see pile of bones http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ml0zISgWDnt1hDWorSMNiw?select=q2GwBmW8YEgIRYr5zuZanQ) Ajisen's tenderous ribs win the ramen rib throwdown.

The cha-han was GREAT! Delicous flavor and nice tender chunks of pork. Made me wish I'd ordered the Cha-shu Ramen :(

The waitress kept my water glass full, but didn't seem like she enjoyed her job.

Oh, and they called their broth Tonk*a*tsu (breaded pork cutlet), not Tonk*o*tsu (pork bone broth). What's up with that?!?

Ramen: 2.5 stars
Cha-han: 5 stars
Service: 3 stars
author: Andrew C.

description: Not sure what the one stars are about. Love the food. Love delivery. Service is just fine.
author: Victoria M.

description:
Genki should really consider changing the "Ramen" out of their name. It really shouldn't be there if they don't plan on delivering.

I was craving for some ramen but Izakaya was closed (second time they have failed me), so a quick search for "ramen" on Yelp and came across Genki Ramen. Was glad to see that it's happy hour, even though nothing much on the menu appealed to me.

Ordered:
     - Garlic Tenderous Rib Ramen($8.75)
     - Chashu Ramen ($7.95)
     - Crispy Daimaru ($4.75) free with check-in on Yelp
     - Takoyaki ($3) happy hour price

I also wanted to order their Happy Hour priced Matcha Swirl ($3) to-go, The waitress kindly told me that I wouldn't get that at HH price, but I can order it, get a to-go cup, then pour it in myself (wtf). I thought it was pointless and wasn't worth the trouble, so I didn't get it.

Their ramen is their claim to fame, since it's clearly in the store name. To be honest though, I thought it was mediocre ramen.

:::Pros:::
     - Not just 2 measly slices of pork 
     - Broth was pretty good
:::Cons::: 
     - Noodles were soggy and 'cheap'
     - Low broth to noodle ratio
     - Prices were high for the quality and quantity
     - Fairly small amount in the bowl

None of the fried appetizers were anything to be proud of either. Both were lacking in filling and were skimping on key ingredients.

:::Crispy Daimaru::: reminiscent of cream cheese wontons. They made the mistake of using 2 skins just to wrap one filling's worth, perhaps to look bigger and it won't look as sad to have 3 big circles on the dish, rather than having 3 pieces that only took half the space. When you bite through the crust and finally get to the filling, it's sorta worth it. A little like imitation crab with spinach. To be fair, this was a free dish so I won't complain too much, but I would be pretty pissed if I paid for this.
:::Takoyaki::: looks really delicious, nicely fried, and had a good taste. It was a whole different story once you bite into it. The batter tasted underfried, and there is only 1 little piece of octopus :\ quite sad. I ended up taking bites of it just to look for the octopus piece and left a bunch of half-eaten takoyaki halves on my plate. 

This is one of those places you come for the ambiance, music, colors on the wall, LCD screens, and the fact that it probably won't get too crowded. They did, however, have good happy hour options and prices (including alcohol). But if they are serious about being a ramen shop, they really need to amp it up because if they only served ramen, this place would be a joke.
author: Azn B.

description:
Came here once with my friend and I thought it wasn't bad. I had the curry katsu ramen and it hit the spot!! We went during lunchtime so it was pretty empty. I thought the atmosphere made me feel like I was at a more high-end restaurant because it was so clean and the furniture was spick and span. From what I remember, the prices were decent. Not too overpriced which I like for some good tasting ramen and broth.

Service was really good and I would probably come back again.
author: Kathleen S.

description: This is the best "non-sushi" Japanese food that I've had in the US.  The ramen and skewers are all awesome and authentic.  Give the peppers and chicken wings a try, I've never found a place before that served the Japanese peppers in the US.  They also have reasonably priced pitchers, so its a great stop on your neighborhood bar run.
author: Cameo W.

description:
Man oh man was I disappointed. The crowd was young, restless and hangry which makes sense since there aren't too many places open after 9 anymore.

When I saw that the prices for ramen were an average of $10 a pop, I thought this ramen must be really good! But no, it was a sad bowl of half filled soup with store bought noodles, imitation crab, lifeless shrimp, scallops and drowned edamame on the bottom.

If the prices were knocked down a three four dollars that matched the lower than average quality I would have understood, but to end my night with a dry mouth and a thirsty appetite...well we all know what happened there.

This was also the first time that I didn't even try the soup because it just all sorts of wrong.

...good service though just to end it on a somewhat good note.
author: Caren K.

description:
Was out with the bf and was looking for a nice place to eat that was a bit on the upscale side, but not totally ludicrously expensive and insane.

Our wandering about the numerous restaurants of the area took us to Genki.

Upon entry, I was very much pleased by the atmosphere of this place. Slightly dark, kind of cozy, but very professional looking and modern. 

The menu has some unique items, and some things you'd come to expect from a place that advertises its specialty as ramen. I ended up going for the cold ramen with chicken, while my boi went for the seafood ramen.

I was surprised at how quickly the food came! You know its gotta be fast if a fast cat says its fast,  Im talking a matter of a couple minutes! 
The ramen was perfect. We both tried each others dishes and were pleasantly surprised over how flavorful everything was. 

The portions are decently sized as well. Not so much you feel like your'e being overloaded, but not so little you feel like you're being swindled. It was just the right size. ^ ^

The service was decent, although the server only came to take the order, bring the order, then bring the bill. Usually, its nice if someone comes at least once to make sure things are ok, or to refill water, which didn't happen, which isn't too much of a big deal, but something we noticed.

Overall, the experience was great! Really good food and nice atmosphere.
Worth a shot if you're in the area!

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
This place is called Genki Ramen, so people probably come here for ramen but I didn't... Lol 

I came with family & one of my family members friend on the night of New Years Eve. I was surprised it wasn't super packed nor did people have to wait long to get seated. I ordered a Veggie Curry over rice & I was surprised of how big the portion was. Not crazy big, but like big enough that I couldn't finish the last bites of it. My sister ordered a Tempura Ramen & she said the soup tasted bland, but the tempura was really good! (it comes on the side) They also have happy hour from 6PM-7 or 8PM & 10PM-closing time where drinks & appetizers are all $3. Pretty amazing! Other than that I would just complain about how the waitresses doesn't really communicate with you. They just take your order, give you your food, refill your water, & take your dishes when done.
author: Ivy Q.

description: They have great ramen here, parking can sometimes be difficult after 7 since Geary and clement are such popular areas.  I like their cha siu ramen, I would usually get it with corn.  It has a lot of flavor and their ramen are very delicious.  If you check in on yelp they usually give you a free appetizer!
author: Danny C.

description:
I've been here a few times with my friends for dinner. Each time I went there I never really ordered the same thing. My ramen was pretty ok.. but honestly have to say I've had better ramen at other restaurants than here. 

Some good flavor from the broth, but it was very light. However, the only reason I'm giving this place 3-stars is for the shrimp appetizer they had there. The presentation alone is really cute, but it packed in a lot of flavor.
author: Lena S.

description: Ordered the Chashu Ramen through Uber Eats and was so pleasantly surprised.  The pork was DELISH. And I really liked how they packaged the broth separately from all the other stuff so it wouldn't get cold or soggy.  The noodles did end up stuck together this way, but they loosened up eventually in the broth.  Definitely would order again.
author: Justin F.

description:
This is an acceptable ramen place.  Nothing fantastic, nothing bad.   Tried two kinds of ramen there and some tempura.  

Good prices though and convenient when looking for food during a union square shopping day. Otherwise, not worth the travel.
author: Anand A.

description:
The one star is because your charged me 18% tip when it's only 2 adults and 3 kids for lunch.  

What make you think I won't tip you? It's not listed on the menu that you will charge 18% for parties of 5 or more. Just because you are slow on Father's Day Sunday doesn't mean you can charge me 18%!!

We ordered from the lunch menu and each of us ordered a full price item with addition side. No kids meal! And we didn't share any food. The only service provided was refilling water. 

The check came out to $51.23 and I'll will give you at least $8 - (15%).  
BTW,  tip is supposed to be before tax!! The 18% was tagged on top of tax, WTF!! This is very dishonest and not acceptable!! 

Food is good but with dishonest servers and owners, this will most likely be my last time!
author: JC C.

description: One of my favorite ramen places in SF. Highly recommend the Kinoko Mushroom Ramen. The broth was so flavorful, the noodles were cooked perfectly and the staff were attentive and helpful. Definitely recommend this place and will be back.
author: Lucy Q.

description:
Chill hole in the wall that a friend recommended.  Overall, the meal was delicious and I would recommend coming here to satisfy your ramen cravings. 

Garlic Tenderous Ribs:  The broth was pretty legit.  Flavor was on point and was not overwhelming that after a few bites. I like the noodle which tasted authentic (unlike the instant noodles lol).  The ribs itself basically slid of the bones...i cant taste the garlic in them but damn were they tender...ous hahaa Thus the name? I dont know, but I wouldnt mind grabbing another one of these babies

Spicy Mussels Appetizer: DAmn these babies were delicious!  If you arent lactose intolerant, then jump on these babies.  The topping was delicious as the shrimp and scallop bits were tasty...never thought to put melted cheese + shrimp and scallots but it was really good.  

My Gripe: I came into the restaurant with my buddy and stood around for 5 minutes waiting to be seated.  Come on man, that is not cool...especially when its duper freezing outside.  I would highly recommend for them to have a man up front chilling or clearing desks. 

Secret Cheat Codes: YELP BENEFITS!!! Basically checking in allows you to get a free seaweed salad.  Portion is tiny, but I am not trippin and it was on the house! Man, it pays to be on Yelp!
author: Viet L.

description:
I must say... the takoyaki is pretty impressive here (that's why they're getting 4 stars). ohhh along with their not-so-shabby menu. customer service was ehhh... let's just say I'm not a fan. 

food came our fairly quick and piping hot! I love a hot steaming bowl of ramen. I ordered the chashu ramen with corn. nothing special. I've had better, but this satisfied my ramen craving... for now. also, when I checked in through yelp - I got a coupon for free chicken karage. too bad the waitress never brought it to the table. FAIL.
author: Ann T.

description:
Instant ramen tastes better than this. Seriously.

The broth has ZERO flavor. It's like drinking boiled water. You call this tonkotsu? What'd you do, dip a pork bone in the pot for 2 minutes? Noodles were obviously store-bought. The "slow cooked pork" was Chinese BBQ Pork. The seasoning and flavor of the Chinese pork just doesn't taste right with ramen, and it overpowered whatever little flavor the ramen had. 

I came in starving, and left highly unsatisfied. No one in our party thought this was good. Nope, not going back.
author: Kazu O.

description:
Been wanting ramen for a long while.

The pdf menu on their website doesn't have as wide of a selection as the menu link http://www.genkiramen.com/home/menu.php

Before coming I checked out their menu to see what a I wanted. I knew I definitely had to try Curry Tonkatsu Ramen & some sort of Okonomiyaki and BF wanted Chashu Ramen. When we came, it wasn't busy for a weekday afternoon which was what I had hoped for.

Came for lunch & ordered:

- $8.95 Sumo Okonomiyaki http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=0qFFqvnyAVpS8QRqqlnn9Q: bacon, cheese, dried bonito fish flakes, seaweed, mayo...

- $7.95 Chashu Ramen http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=WELpTRiGj9p6hRFSOTHkgA : house made boiled pork, half boiled egg, bamboo shoot, green onion and red ginger in tonkatsu base

- $7.50 Curry Tonkatsu Ramen http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=K_acgzB8WjoYXXAXRCIIQA: Fried crispy pork swimming in curry sauce broth in tonkatsu base using noodles (ramen) as floaties. Along with the pork, he came with his veggie friends, potatos & carrots.

Both the Ramen were pretty good but it made me insanely thirsty. The okonomiyaki tasted a bit burnt at the bottom, but the bacon & cheese medley was good. It wasn't too spectacular as I imagined, I guess expectations were too high. Lots of flies in here. The one waitress watched us & the other customers like a hawk (standing 5 feet away), at times it was uncomfortable.

I might come back for Happy Hour, $3 appeteasers (HIMYM & BBT, get it? maybe not).

Overall 4 stars for food & 2 stars for everything else.
author: Kylie L.

description: It was one of those rainy cold nights where leaving the house seems like a bizarre idea so I had my meal delivered through Eat 24. Ordered the Cha Shu Ramen and Veggie Curry because a mama likes to eat. The ramen hit home for me. It wasn't too salty nor was it bland. My son enjoyed the ramen also and that says a little something because he is a pho baby. I would've liked the veggie curry to have not been so oily. Actually, I wouldn't liked it to not be oily at all. Other than that, I'd say the food is alright. 3.5 stars imo.
author: Thuy L.

description: It isn't how it used to be. Small portion on the ice cream now. and $1 extra for Nutella spread??
author: David S.

description: We went on a bad day to go... The Ramen Festival. We had ditch the festival because of the long wait and small portions and thought that we could find better. So are hunt started. We went to two other ramen places on Geary but only to find that they closed at 3...it was 2:54p.. so our hunt continued until we found Genki. We where so happy until we found out it would be an hour wait, stupid festival. Well we ended up waiting because we had to have ramen, and I'm glad we did. It was soo good! When I checked in on yelp we got a free appetizer which made it even better. The staff were so busy but did a great job. Would defiantly go back...just not when there is a Ramen festival.
author: Nikki H.

description:
This is my little brother's FAVORITE ramen spot near home, so I have been here a billion times thanks to him. 

Long story short, I have to admit that the food here is pretty good - a bit better than average in taste and fast/decent service. My brother has been trying various ramen bowls here lately and I have tried a variety of things on their menu (ramen, curry, sides, etc) - we've both been fairly happy. Oh, and I always order Blue Night, which my brother likes to steal "a few sips" (drinks practically half) of it. 

Basically, if you want a quick and fairly decent spot for food, give this place a try.
author: Christina L.

description:
Good selection of ramen, I had a tough time choosing. I ended up having the kimchi ramen, which came with just 2 pieces of pork and some kimchi that didn't flavor the noodles/soup much. My friend's tan tan ramen was much more interesting. The noodles are fine. They have a ton of other dishes too, and a pretty decent happy hour.

Check in on Yelp for a freebie edamame/tofu!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Ramen was extremely bland. 
Haven't tried anything else, but the ramen had no flavor and the egg was hard boiled (usually the best part of ramen when cooked right).
author: Kaila E.

description:
I've come here a couple of times with my friends. Once on for lunch and once for my birthday. The staff there are friendly, but the food is even better.

I usually order a seafood ramen which lacks a little bit in flavor but still good and largely portioned.

The reason why I LOVE this place is because of the maccha swirl drink and the chocolate fondue. YUMMMMY! Definitely coming back for all of the aforementioned.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
This is my second time here with about 10 month between each visit. 

I only think the ramen is okay. The broth is ok, not too flavorful. However, if you're a picky eater (no green onions, no bean sprouts, and alright with bamboo shoots), it's a nice change in bowl- since you don't have to spend time plucking out stuff you don't like. But, I'd rather have good taste over spending a couple minutes plucking out the green onions in my charsu ramen.  I have to say that they give "large" portions of charsu. It's like 4 pieces semi-thick (2 quarters thick) charsu. 

I had the chicken karagge, it's mostly batter. Total bummer.
author: Jess W.

description:
I was really excited to go to a ramen house to give it a try. Came in time for the happy hour items. The only worth while item I thought was the sesame wings for $3. It actually had some decent taste to it and the size of the wings were a good size - came with 4. 

I had the kimchi ramen. Ramen wasn't anything special, a scoop of kimchi was plopped in with two slices of pork. However, the pork was quite flavorful. 

I went with my fiance and we always swap bowls half way. I got to try the pork katsu curry ramen (i think it was number 403 on the menu). It was alright... I'm not sure if I find the crispy katsu soaked in curry broth appealing. I don't think I will order this again.

For checking in, we got to have a free order of croquettes. Which are two fried pieces of potatoes. Maybe because it was FREE that it tasted delicious.

the grilled scallops on the skewer wasn't so great. By the time I had it, it was already cold. I think scallops is just one of those food items that is extremely difficult to season. There was a dallop of orange sauce on each scallop that I thought was a little too sweet for my liking --- kind of like a sweet orange colored mayonnaise. 

I can't remember the name of the item on the happy hour menu but it came out to be little pieces of fried chicken. Pretty much like your battered chicken nugget. I don't think I would buy that again for $3. It should have been $1 for the quantity provided.

The squid balls --- the happy hour item that starts with a letter "T." It wasn't so bad when it was hot but when it got cold it wasn't too appealing. It's literally a small piece of squid battered into a ball of dough that is then deep fried. 

Had the seafood pancake. It is particularly good when it comes out nice and hot. I'm not sure how it is on a regular basis but the center of our pancake was a bit moist. I couldn't decipher whether or not it was uncooked batter of the seafood juices made the batter mushy. 

I may or may not try this restaurant again. I have a bit of mixed feelings.
author: Mary N.

description:
Came for a late meal before I start my shift.

Noticed their Lunch Special runs until 5pm.

Ordered:

Lunch Special Item: Chasu Ramen with Chicken Karage combo, also requested extra bamboo

Apart from that, also ordered:

Yakitori:
Ox tongue
Scallop
Tomato and Pumpkin

All the yakitori came out dripping in oil, which is somewhat disgusting, and definitely not how a Japanese yakitori should be (at least not the ones I've been to). The ox tongue was cut into cubes, which made the meat hard and dry. Recommend them to cut it into slices instead, would be more tender. The scallop was nice, but again, not so fond of the oil. The tomato and pumpkin was a nice idea, but the cherry tomato turned out to be sour, the pumpkin too hard, and again, everything dripping in oil.

Also ordered a garden salad, which turned out to be SO small that its not worth the $3 at all! How small you ask? I finished it in 3 bites, with the lettuce and tomato and the corn bits. THAT was how small it was. For something that is similar to a house salad that cost $3, it was definitely not worth ordering.

The Chasu Ramen came in a big bowl, but it had a shallow dish, which meant the serving was not as big as you thought. And even with the extra bamboo that I requested, the total amount of bamboo came to about a spoonful (and that was me being generous). So I'm paying $2 extra topping for less that what i can with a regular order at any other Ramen place! Also, they only serve you half an egg, and it was hard boiled, not the soft-boiled egg I am so fond of when having Ramen.

The ramen noodle was also pathetic little in portion. Usually i can only eat about half of the ramen at any other places, but at this place, even all with the extra food that I ordered, i still finished all the noodle and craved more. And the waitress assured me that the lunch special serving was the same as the regular portion...

Last but not least, the broth they used for the ramen probably had MSG added into it, because I was feeling super thirsty the whole time, not to mention my tongue was also feeling a little bit weird (a common side effect when I consume MSG).

The only saving grace of the whole dining experience was their karage, which was crispy, tender, and juicy. Too bad I ordered the lunch special and there wasn't enough to make the rest of the nightmare go away.

Service was also non-existent. 10 minutes into my meal my water cup was running empty, and with two waitress and two other tables, I was not offered a refill the entire time (I was there for about 35minutes total). And no one came to ask how I was doing once they were done serving my food.

This is a place I would avoid. Overpriced for the portion, MSG added Ramen, oily yakitori, and bad service. Begone, my nightmare!
author: C W.

description: For full discloser, I ordered delivery from this place and did not actually go to the restaurant. I ordered veggie cold ramen, shrimp tempura and baked scallops. It all tasted alright, although I wish the veggie ramen had more flavor since it just had a little bit of cream sauce on it. The tempura was pretty good. It wasn't the crispiest, but I think that is because I got it delivered.  The scallops were in a decent sauce. What was a disappointment was the serving sizes. I thought those three dishes would be enough for two people, but it really really wasn't.
author: Valentina G.

description:
Genki's menu had a wide variety of several different types of food, such as appetizers, 10+ different types of ramen, rice plates, alcoholic & non-alcoholic beverages, etc. I was pleasantly surprised.

My friend and I each were looking at the great selection of ramen - I ended up getting the Butter, corn and pork (#414), which had great noodles and meat. However, when I first tasted it, it was very bland. It seemed like they forgot to put soy sauce in it, but once I added some soy sauce in myself, it tasted EXCELLENT. Loved the corn, and there were 2 big pieces of meat which was good enough for me.  My friend got a veggie ramen, with mushrooms and other various vegetables that looked very colorful. I didn't try it but it looked delicious!

Another plus was the service. My friend and I were perusing the ramen page, but when we were ordering, the waitress mentioned the lunch specials on the back page, which was basically the same price as the regular ramen, but you get a free side dish too! (2 gyoza, chicken karage or pork fried rice). Side dishes were average, but still a nice touch for lunch.

Cozy atmosphere, with top 40s music, and decent ramen. However I am still searching for the top ramen noodle shop in SF!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Party of 5, with not much service and forced to pay gratitude tip. The gratitude tip was over 20%! I will never come back. The cost for the amount of ramen is not worth it. Though it was average, I wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Gray L.

description:
Spicy Mabo Tofu Ramen ... Get it. 

I honestly have never been there in person. But I get delivery from there at least twice a week. I think it says something if their delivery ramen is some of the best ramen i've ever had. ( Just the Spicy Mabo tofu Ramen.. I had two of the others and I thought they were good but not mind blowing).
author: Jessie L.

description: Cheap crappy ramen. Found a foil in my ramen. They gave me a new bowl with a bigger portion. Food isn't worth the price
author: Phillip C.

description: Very good ramen, open late too! The waitresses were friendly. I'll be back, but I recommend just ordering the ramen. I've had the gyoza and the shumai and both were very average. Also delivery quality isn't as great as eating in.
author: Emily A.

description:
DEAL:  CHECK IN ON YELP AND GET FREE CHICKEN KAARAGE!

This spot is well hidden behind a sidewalk tree but don't be deceived, inside it's lively and full of people!  Luckily, they take reservations so IF you absolutely have the craving for some GENKI, I would call just to make sure they save you a seat.  We called 30 minutes prior to arriving and they had a seat ready and waiting for our party of 4.

MABO TOFU RAMEN - unique and tasty!  Not your traditional Ramen and honestly, this place is a ball full of Ramen varietals that are off the beaten path of your Himawari/Ramen Dojo/Santa Ramen type places... I don't even know if you can really compare since the style is so different.  So, if you go in with an open mind you will be pleasantly surprised by all the options.  I would recommend this plate.

They also have Yakisoba options which come out on a hot plate and are OK too.  I prefer their Ramen noodles since their soup bases are rather tasty.  

Consistent and dependable.  I would come back when I'm feening for a quick bowl of Ramen!
author: Sandy L.

description: Good service and good ramen selection.  Try the kimchi ramen - good mix of spice and flavors.
author: J Z.

description:
Meh.

We got the tofu for free because of the yelp check in and thank goodness because it was pretty blah. It literally tasted like cold tofu from the box w/some seasoning they threw on top.

I ordered the chasu ramen and the egg was overcooked and the pork tasted bland and was overcooked. But, at 10:30 PM on a Sunday night, it was the only ramen place open which is why it gets 2 stars instead of 1. 

Finally, the music was on so loud everyone had to scream to talk to each other and by the end of the night I was ready to leave so I could hear my thoughts.

Probably not going back, unless I'm desperate.
author: Pamela B.

description:
I hate to be such a grinch and rain on everyone else's good reviews but I'm not a big fan of Genki Ramen. Sure, the $2 happy hour chicken karaage is not bad but other than that, I found everything else I've had in my few times dining there to be lackluster. 

You would think that since I am a fan of the chicken karaage, I'd be a fan of the chicken karaage ramen right? Wrong! Something about the broth or maybe the grease from the chicken karaage mixed in with the mediocre broth made me loose my appetite. Whatever it is, I can't pin point what exactly turned my taste buds off. The mabo tufo ramen I had the next time was a tad better but still can't save Genki from a two-star rating. I found it to be a big boring, I like varieties when it comes to my noodles!

The service is always a bit slow and the waitresses are always inattentive. It's a shame because the space and presentation of the food is nice-- it's just too bad that the customer experience, like their food, can only garner 2 stars from me.
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Tasty for a good price. Service is fast and friendly. 

Recommendations:
-Seafood pancake
-House chashu ramen
author: Win H.

description:
Being the ramen fiends that we are, Bun and I were wondering about this place for awhile.  At first sight, this place looks really franchise-like.  They appear to take a page from the book of Aijisen.  It's interesting to see a sign that they cater, comes off as a bad sign to me.  There's a clipboard waiting list in the front after entering the doorway.  On the day we went, the clipboard wasn't needed.  We were sat immediately and upon checking in saw there was an offer for free edamame or chicken karaage.        

On this ramen outing, I actually got my parents to come with us.  That was a nice change of pace.  It's always a funny sight to see my parents react to food they don't necessarily eat on a normal basis.  While my parents only shared a bowl of chicken teriyaki which came with miso and a salad, we went to the route of ramen of course.  Little Bun ordered the nori ramen combo with pork fried rice and I got the chicken karaage ramen combo with gyoza (comes with two).   

The ramen looked fine at first glance, until further investigation things were different than they appear.  The taste of it didn't do the presentation justice.  Like a less than half filled reservoir during drought season, the bowl was big; what was inside wasn't as much as one would visually expect.  The chicken karaage, placed on a separate plate, was appetizing enough.  The coat of batter wasn't overdone and not overly oily.  Regrettably, I can't be as positive about the ramen.  The noodles lacked the chewiness expectant of awesome noodles; texture of it felt overcooked.  Due to the lack of other ingredients, the broth was forced to be the epicenter.  Regrettably, the broth couldn't shoulder a more favorable overall approval with a flat lining flavor that was satisfactory at best.  

Because of the area, my expectations were slightly raised.  Most of the disappointing points were derived from that notion of thinking.  I may be harsh in critique, but there are some encouraging aspects.  The ramen combinations are good deals.  It'll definitely fill the stomach at an affordable price.  There's a check-in offer however long it may last. The happy hour times give Genki Ramen a step up compared to options like Halu that is also in the vicinity that opens only at night.  I'd defer to other restaurants in the area with so many choices, but Genki is a decent enough outlet for simple ramen needs.
author: Arnold T.

description:
I went here a couple of weeks ago with my husband, after we had recently tried a different ramen place. This is the WORST ramen I've ever had. And the WORST service I've had since Buffalo Wild Wings in Daly City. 

It was packed and we figured it must be decent. They sat us at a cramped table, which had no condiments whatsoever. My edamame was severely undercooked and could have used some serious salt. I figured maybe it was just me. So when our ramen came out, my husband forced himself to eat a couple of bites. I only ate my noodles because I was starving but it had NO flavor. I've had Top ramen noodles that had more flavor then this place. 

Our waitress never came to check on us, ever. They brought out our food, never refilled my empty water glass, and when we were both obviously done, we actually had to wave someone down to get our check. Even after we did that, we waited another 15 MINUTES before she brought it. I watched her buzz around doing everything but getting our check. 

WORST service AND food I've had in a while. I will NOT be returning ever.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Garlic Tenderous Rib ramen!!! oh so yummyyy. Sliced roasted garlic, pork soft bone, half broiled egg and spinach in a tonkotsu base $9.75. I also tried some of my sister's kim chi ramen but it couldn't beat the one I ordered!! Definitely coming back for more! 

I also got a free croquette for checking in on Yelp or Foursquare.. one of those.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
What is the point of placing an order for pick up and showing up at the appointed 20 minutes later if when I arrive the order hasn't been put in yet? Not that that stopped them from charging my card.

Not only did they not apologize for their f-up, they were rude when I pointed out that it was their mistake!

UNACCEPTABLE.

Way to waste my time.

Grrrr.

I asked to speak to a manager, and was told "There's no manager." Really? That certainly speaks volumes.

I demanded a refund and left to get dinner elsewhere.

Never again.
author: Ms J.

description:
Four LCD TVs all hi-def...nice
Cool tunes piping in...nice
Side-bar with decent sake...nice
Beers on tap, including IPA...nice

Yes...I did order food btw.

I went with Order #404 Curry Chicken Katsu Ramen Combo ... Extra dollar for side fried chicken.

The curry chicken katsu was just excellent. It was a pounded thigh-meat fried to panko-breading-perfection. The meat was tender and piping hot atop the noodles. I dived into the chicken to experience that great crunch.

Holy sh*t, that was good. 
The broth was very savory
The noodles were firm/al dente. 

The side fried chicken were three pieces of BREAST meat fried with a mei-fun/rice flour (that's how my pops did it).

They give Hi-Chews instead of a mint with your bill. 
Nice touch.
author: Derek N.

description: Great deal on the lunch special and the fried chicken and free seaweed salad were good. But the actual ramen was uber salty and they didnt offer non fried chicken with veggies and didnt seem able to make it. Good value for the price though and great service.
author: Patricia A.

description:
Came in with my wife at 5:50 saw that we still had 10 minutes before happy hour was over at 6, ordered a chicken karage and a gyoza right away before ordering our ramen. When we got our bill, one appetizer was charged the $4 early bird price and the other was charged the $5.50 regular price. Only $1.50 difference, but as my wife says it's the principle. Floor manager argued that we had ordered after happy hour. We pointed out that we had ordered both together, either both are one price or both the other, why one more and one less? After a lot of back and forth, she fixed the bill.  Unprofessional! 
We sat on one end of a four top table, yet when they served us, all the food was placed at the unused part of the table rather than front of us, even though we had nothing in front of us. Lazy!
Food was good, but service was lacking. Beware and view your check before you pay.
author: Poi L.

description:
Solid 2 stars. The ramen in my butter & corn ramen was too hard. Same with my girlfriend's seafood cold ramen which was even harder since they chill it. The only savior was the fact that they had a wide assortment of appetizers and snack foods: chicken karaage, yakitori, tako balls...  However, the tako balls only had one small cube of octopus in the fried batter. 

I don't understand Genki's "popularity"... when we left the restaurant was full and a line was forming.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
I've only had delivery from this place and it's been delicious. After a long day working in the cold city, I'm usually sniffly and yearning for something hot. While on the bus home, I'll pull up the grubhub app and order a warm bowl of Ramen. 

Each time I've ordered, they've come at a timely manner, once they've left out an item, but with a quick call they quickly credited my order. For delivery, their Ramen is solid and I've yet to be disappointed. Just make sure you have a bowl large enough at home to mix the noodles and the soup!
author: Mindy T.

description: Nothing to write home about, but gets the job done when you're craving ramen and all the better places are closed. Kudos for being open between lunch and dinner on a holiday and for decent broth and a good portion of cha siu. Demerits for hard boiled/overdone egg and mushy noodles.
author: Erica W.

description:
Happy hour from 3pm-7pm everyday is yelp worthy! $3 drinks and $3 on some appetizers. But the ramen itself is average. I've tried many different ramen restaurants and am probably a ramen snob by now.

I appreciate the wide variety of ramen they have on their menu.  I tried the Chashu ramen: "house made boiled pork, half boiled egg, bamboo shoot, green onion and red ginger in tonkatsu base" and my bf had the Curry Chicken Katsu: "deep fried chicken fillet, potato, carrot with curry sauce in tonkatsu base for ". I still enjoyed the ramen very much, but as I always say, it's hard to come by a bad bowl of ramen noodles. The amount and thickness of their chashu was good. And I think I prefer my curry and chicken katsu with rice - not mixed with ramen noodles and soup.

Overall it's a great place to go on a cold night with some friends! There are several flat screen TVs and the restaurant itself is somehow both trendy and comforting.

$26 for two bowls of ramen + small Kirin beer and tax and tip!
author: Samantha L.

description:
This is one of my favorite ramen spots in the SF. It's a bit out of downtown, and parking can be hard to find of Geary, but all the struggles are worth the delicious Ramen they serve. I have tried their Curry Ramen, and their Negi Beef Ramen, and I love them both. I would prefer the Negi Beef Ramen over anything else. The ramen comes to the table very hot and it's the best feeling taking the warm sip of their broth on a cold SF day (AKA every evening). Their lunch menu is the best time to go, as it's a great deal with the additional side dish. I usually get the Chashu Rice, and it's pretty delicious. The staff are very friendly, and explain the different dishes pretty well. The only complain I have with their place is that the portions are a bit small, and if they made them a bit bigger to match the price they sell them, it would be a 5 star place for me! 

TLDR: Good ramen place, with friendly service!
author: Nakul B.

description:
Went there yesterday for lunch since I was craving for some hot ramen; found this on yelp and decided to give it a try.

I had their chasiu ramen and grilled lamb chop, rib eye & gizzards; they were all perfectly grilled! For the price, I think they are awesome!

I love their ramen soup base too, not too salty and it's just the way I like it, chasiu tasty good and tender as well. The noodle is slightly overcooked but overall very nice restaurant with good food.

I missed the food already.
author: Sammy C.

description:
It was a Sunday afternoon and we wanted to have ramen for lunch. We decided on heading over to Genki Ramen. The commute wasn't too difficult since it is accessible by public transportation. Just on the next block is a hair salon, so if you're in need of a haircut, like Bunny was, then coming here is the perfect choice!

Like most ramen restaurants, there was a sign in sheet, but since it was around 2, it wasn't too busy and we were seated right away. Bunny and I were here with his parents. After glancing at the menu, I noticed there wasn't miso, which is one of my favorite ramen dishes. I was slighly disappointed, but decided on getting the Nori, which was wakame, corn and nori in miso base. For $1, you can add a side so I decided on the pork fried rice. Bunny decides a side of gyoza. 

After ordering and getting settled in, we decided to "check-in." Well, it turns out that one of the offers is a free chicken karaage, Darn, should have done this beforehand. Bunny kept his order of chicken karraga ramen. However if we had seen this first, he would have picked a different type of ramen, instead of ending up with two of the same things!

 We get the server's attention and order the appetizer. First comes out the chicken karagge, which is okay. It is a bit hard and lacks some flavor. The servers are friendly and the presentation of our dishes are nice. Our ramen came in a big bowl on a tray with the side dishes placed there as well. There were two large piece of seaweed and a good amount of corn. The noodles were chewy and tasty, but a little bland. The gyoza is alright as well. 

This wouldn't be my top pick for ramen. However if in the area, I'd come back.
author: Doris W.

description: Love this place! Been coming here since like forever. It is definitely not authentic ramen by any means but it will fulfill your ramen craving for a good price. I can only speak for the ramen. I've never tried anything else. Come during happy hour. You can order appetizers for only 3 bucks.
author: Jennalyn L.

description:
Having driving past this Ramen shop many times before, I decided to try them for lunch. The Chashu Ramen came out warm, as I prefer the soup to be at least steaming from the bowl.

 The broth was good as it was flavorful and not overly salted. Pork was plentiful and very tender & lean. Ramen was OK, I used to a bowl full so I was a little disappointed. The other topping of 1/2 egg, bamboo shoots, green onions and ginger was well presented.

 The gyoza were very good however and freshly made with a dipping sauce. Friendly service and lounge like atmosphere. Will come soon to try other ramen & entrees.
author: Wolfy W.

description: I've only been in during lunch time. Very fast. I like their sizzling ramen platters.
author: Isabel A.

description:
Never. Go. Here.

The mango salad was weird and all those different flavors, while great on their own, did NOT mix well. The ramen was mediocre. I got the Yasai and it was basically just veggies stir-fried with soy sauce with no other flavor. The noodles were not very al dente and the broth was forgettable. Oooookaayyy. My friend got the Chashu ramen and while I didn't try it, she said it was below average. 

But that is not the sole reason I'm giving this place 1 star (0 if there were that option). The main reason I am giving it the lowest rating possible is because they did not bring out my friend's ramen until ONE HOUR after we had placed our order. The mango salad came out pretty quickly. Then, there was a pretty long 15-20 min wait before I got my ramen. Then, while my hungry friend smiled wanly and encouraged me not to let my ramen get cold, I had to eat guiltily while she looked on (I offered her some every 5 minutes). We flagged the waitress multiple times to ask her what was going on and she never gave us an explanation and also NEVER APOLOGIZED.

When the ramen finally came out, the waitress mumbled an excuse about the kitchen having to put together a large order for delivery. We just stared at her in disbelief. How does a kitchen get so backed up by one delivery order that it can't put together a bowl of ramen in less than an hour? I mean, come on! You throw the pre-cooked noodles, pre-cooked pork, pre-cooked broth in a bowl and add a spoon. You really need an hour to do that? (And let's not kid ourselves--Genki Ramen is not the type of place to make everything fresh from scratch for each order. Even if it were, it wouldn't take an hour to put together a Chashu Ramen.)

In sum: Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Josephine L.

description:
Wow. I'm so surprised other yelpers aren't on board with this place. I just moved to the neighborhood and this has been one of my weekly go-tos since the fall. 

They make a DELICIOUS veggie ramen. And you can get all of the noodle dishes with a veggie base if you prefer. The BF usually has a pork dish (he gets the credit for discovering this gem) and we have a piece of seared salmon on the side. It's quick, healthy and inexpensive... in the best possible way.

It's usually fairly crowded here, but we never have to wait more than a few minutes. And the service is good -- not overly in-your-face, but you get what you need when you need it. 

You should definitely eat here.
author: Gretchen S.

description: Went back again this morning, and damn that was some good ramen!  Still standing by my review!
author: John D.

description:
I went here the other day because the J-pop festival was too insanely overcrowded. I called in a reservation and we waited about an hour for seating.

First of all, the service here was purely terrible. Not only did they take orders around tables around us that were seated AFTER us, it took them 30 minutes to give us water, despite giving every other table water. We had to actually constantly ask for water because we ate the appetizer way before we even got water. It took forever to even get in contact with our server as well and the other tables that came after us were finished eating before we even got our main entrees.

As for the food, I ordered a takoyaki appetizer, which tasted really good and chashu ramen w/ pork rice lunch special. I thought the ramen was just okay, my friends got various other ramen's including tan tan men, which my friend felt was too meaty. 

Another thing that bothered me was we came in with a group of 5, there was no mention of gratuity. It's not even posted on the menu or anywhere. They had to literally write it on the check, which I felt was unfair.

The service was just so bad for us, we were completely irritated by the server and staff. It made the experience very bad for us.

Parking was also very difficult since its street parking on a weekend day. Thankfully we got lucky and caught someone leaving.
author: Mariah L.

description:
Bar: Japanese tropical cocktails were refreshing.  

Noodle: taste fresh 
Broth: Tonkatsu. Perfect balance. Creamy, rich full bodied. Not too salty.
Portion: regular size was more than enough to fill me up & yes I finished it! 
Chashu: was a thick slice, savory & well marinated.  
Egg: Soft boiled perfection.
Atmosphere: semi-casual & comfortable. Overall fast & friendly service. Plenty of TVs to watch sports in any seat you choose. 

Sushi: fresh & not too packed w/ rice. Small portions though.
author: Rhea C.

description: You know, for a ramen place, this place its the ritz. It's right on geary, so if you're driving, good luck finding street parking at any time during the day. Otherwise, highly reccomend both the food and the restaurant itself. The food is delicious, although the price could be better, especially the noodles and appetizers. Me and my roommates tend to order here as a treat when we're craving some Japanese food but don't want to go too far out of the area. They have pick up so if you're on the way back home in the richmond area, its a good place to call ahead and have food ready to go!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Would that there were a zero star option. When we were seated the waitress gave us the lunch menu.  We ordered from that menu and decided to try the sides since they were $1. When the bill came we were charged dinner prices because the menu we had been given was only offered until 5:00. So now it is our fault that we ordered from the menu that we were given? We used to (as of up until this evening) do take out here regularly. We will never, ever order in or out from this bait and switch trap again. Ever. I get to put my single word Japanese vocabulary to use - Sayonara. Food was never that good anyway - just came because my teen thought it was. Good riddance.
author: Colleen S.

description:
A great location for a late night snack, as this restaurant is open until 11 PM on the weekdays.  I wasn't particularly thrilled with the quality of their food but it hit the spot.  The restaurant itself is a really cool hangout spot.  They play fun music and lots of people in their mid-20s hangout here.

I was a little disappointed that they couldn't give me grilled shrimp.  All their add ins (like chicken) are fried.  Which is a huge bummer.  The noodles are a bit stiff and take a long time to get soft.  I like my noodles nice and soggy.

Prices are reasonable enough.  If you check-in through Yelp, you get a free Edamame or Daimaru (which is a circular fried wonton with cream cheese and spinach.)  We got the Daimaru.  It wasn't the most tasty so go for the Edamame.

This place is ok but I will stick to Pho, as the noodles are much more to my liking and they usually offer healthier options like grilled shrimp.
author: Victoria C.

description:
My recent night at Genki ramen was my first experience with ramen. That being said, I can't say whether Genki does it really well or just mediocre. 

However, I will say it's not a great place to go if you're vegetarian/vegan. There are very few options, even if you tweek some of them to exclude items that make them non-veg (such as asking for appetizers or dishes without bonito flakes.) Also, I'm a little inclined to think that almost anything you get here is going to have some fish thing in it, even if the menu doesn't state it does (nor does the server.) I got the non-broth version of the curry veggie. It was really good, but I had a stomach ache afterwards and I don't know whether it was just really filling or if something was in it that shouldn't have been.

If it weren't for the stomach ache (which didn't occur until after I left the restaurant), I'd say the food was pretty good overall. In addition to the curry veggie, I got the tofu salad (without bonito.) Both dishes appeased both my tastebuds and hunger. Also, my friends and I got to take advantage of the free appetizer you can get right now if you check-in on yelp!!

I probably wouldn't go here again, both because of the limited options and it being pretty far from my usual neighborhood haunts. But it's probably not a bad option if you're looking for food in that area and don't have dietary restrictions.
author: Jon T.

description: The place was really crowded but it was just the atmosphere of the restaurant. The ramen was really minimal but there option to add what ever you would like which is great! The decor is good. The service was not great it was 6/10. Good place to bring in friends for a RAMEN EXPERIENCE. Additional pieces to add the the ramen were decent in pricing and choices. GREAT DATE SPOT. (call in first if you can)
author: Sothary C.

description:
Arrived with 13 ppl, seated in 10 min. Which is not bad but then it took the waitress about 15 min to come back and took our order. 

Ramen noodle was over cooked, soup was blend and meat was not tender. Maybe it was late and quality decreases. :/
author: Tommy Q.

description:
It was pretty tasty. Ambiance was eh, food came quickly. Pretty sure it had a lot of MSG-- I got super tired and thirsty. 

I had the first dish, with homemade pork, which was a few slices of pork. I think I'd try the rib style next time. 

Kimchi was good and not too spicy.
author: Dina G.

description:
I've been here a few times and it never fails to satisfy me! I typically get the hot ramen and it is always sooo good. I haven't been to too many places that serve ramen, so then I don't really have much to compare it to. But, every time I crave it, I always go here because I really love their ramen. I sometimes think about tring their other food selections, but I can't help myself to just get the ramen! It's one of my favorites :]. Prices are decent for the amount you get (I always have leftovers). Services is decent, all servers take care of all tables, so that's nice. When I've been, the waits weren't too long, sometimes there was no wait at all.
Their 5 stars here is mostly for their ramen seeing as how I haven't tried much of their other selections.
author: Monica M.

description:
It was cold outside and allll I ever wanted was a hot bowl of yummy ramen soup!!

This was our first go at Ramen and I heard this where we should get our footsies wet! When we checked in, we realized we got a free appetizer of friend chicken which wasnt half bad at all. I chose the seafood ramen and my husband got the garlic lamb ramen. His broth was a little bitter for his taste so he ended up eating the lamb and the noodles. My broth was ok. A little sweet but maybe because there was a lot of imitation crab inside of it that gave off its sweetness. But none the less it very much edible and hit the spot on a cold cold night. 

The service was just great and there were no complaints. 

Will we be back? Not sure. I am thinking there might be better ramen out there and so my search continues for that perfect bowl of deliciousness continues!
author: Michelle I.

description:
Cafe-looking ramen house. Serves ramen and robatayaki (food grilled over charcoal). 

Garlic Tenderous Rib $8.75 (2.5 of 5) sliced roasted garlic, pork soft bone, half boiled egg and spinach in tonkatsu base. Noodles were soggy. Braised ribs were marinated in heavy sugar and soy sauce. Once the ramen broth was poured over the bowl, the taste of spinach and the sugared ribs overpowered the ramen broth. I can't believe the components of the ramen overpowered the broth itself. That's very disappointing and I won't be coming back to this place anytime soon.
author: Janice T.

description: I've never had bad food when I was here and the wait time isn't bad. They do deliver which is nice, but they have a tip minimum you have to hit before you can order. Because of that you have to pay by card. The thing about me and tips is that I will never not tip you, but I don't want to be made to already tip you because I want to reward you based on how well you do. If I'm already made to tip you online, then I likely will not have a way to supplement what you did since I'm not likely to have small bills on me. And you're likely not going to have change when people have to pay for their food before delivery. So they get a star off for that.
author: Celyn C.

description:
Average, or a little below. My gauge for decent ramen are a couple places in Japantown including Izumiya, take that for what it's worth. Chashu ramen was very bland, small bowl. "Homemade" pork was "ok" but nothing great. Service a bit distracted (had to grab my own seasonings from other tables as my request was forgotten for over 5 minutes). 

Not terrible if you are hard up for some ramen in this area, but there are so many better places to eat around here that I don't think I will prioritize a return. About same price as Japantown, which is sort of sad as the rent must be more there...
author: T J.

description:
The ramen, well I've had worst. Then again I've had better, much better. This is pretty much a Chinese owned Japanese ramen house that caters to a younger clientele. I have a feeling based upon my experience that they use MSG and other kitchen enhancements to kicks up the flavor, rather than spend the long hours of time to really make a tasty stock. Can you tell? If you don't know what I'm talking about, then it really doesn't matter, right? If it tastes good, then eat it. 

That being said, If I were you,  I would stick with the basic chashu ramen. The chicken karaage was also good. All else was eh. 

Not a destination spot for me. J-town is just 5 minutes away and there are several places there that I like better. JMHO.
author: Dom L.

description:
I went here on a whim actually on the way to another ramen place that didn't look as good once I walked by. This place was crowded without having a huge line and had a cool atmosphere so I took a chance. 

I had the seafood ramen and it was delish -- definitely ask for spicy.

Nice but small bar, flat screen TV for games, and quick, attentive servers.
author: Lauren C.

description: OK service! staff sometimes friendly. Ramen noodle is good for the kiddos and the adults. My family usually go there for the kids bento box.
author: Dulmaa Bor R.

description:
Me and my friend were excited to try out some delicious ramen.  Both of us ordered the chicken chicken karaage, and eagerly awaited our food in a starved state after a few hours studying on the beach.  Our portions were generous, but the ramen simply failed to impress.  The soup and noodles both were okay, but lacked any real character.  I'm always a fan of spicy, but I found myself needing to use way more chili powder and hot chili oil than any party of six should need to use.  

There was nothing bad about our soup.  But both me and my friend agreed, there wasn't that much to love, either.  

On a more positive note, beers here were only $3, so it seems like a reasonable place to grab a drink.
author: Alex H.

description:
Went here yesterday with my boyfriend because he was feeling a little under the weather, and we had a fairly pleasant experience!

We both had ramen. I had the Chashu which was really good! And my boyfriend got the Garlic Tenderous Rib, which had the ribs literally falling off the bone because it was so tender! Haha 

I especially like this place because it's open late night, and it's perfect because I always get out of work so late, so it's a win! Will definitely be coming back.
author: Jia A.

description:
I am somewhat of a snob when it comes to good ramen!  This place has never been as good as Tanpopo, Suzu, Dojo Ramen, Himawari, and a few others.  However, in the past I gave it an A-OK 3 stars.  Not today!   

I ordered the Chicken Karaage Ramen.  For starters, it was brought to my table lukewarm, the bowl was barely 1/2 full, and there was next to nil' in the way of broth. The chicken karaage was way overdone and tough.  

Lukewarm Ramen, 1/2 full bowl, next nil' broth, and karaage overdone & tough.  I hope for their sake it was just a bad day for the chef!
author: Robin A.

description:
Nice set up & bar.  We also came in time for Happy Hour, but stuck to ramen only.  Happy Hour has $3 select appetizers & drinks.  I was so tempted to get the spicy mabo tofu ramen, but didn't know how spicy it'd be, so I stuck with the chicken karaage ramen ($8.50).  

The karaage perfectly crispy & juicy, & thank you Genki for putting it on a separate plate!  The ramen broth was tonkatsu based; I'm used to miso & soy based..the tonkatsu base didn't taste that flavorful.  The noodles' consistency was okay, not as chewy as I'm used to. The soup also had corn, wakame, & some green onion.  The soup was also only semi-hot.  Bf thought his cha shu ramen ($8.95) was okay.  Our friend got the seafood ramen ($8.95) & was pleasantly surprised that there was mussels along with shrimp in it.  She said her taste buds were probably skewed from her cold though, but thought it was okay.

Service was very attentive & friendly.  I like how they have different options for ramen; I'm used to only seeing ramen with pork in it at Himawari; so i had to get the chicken karaage ramen!  The ramen is okay, I wouldn't go out of my way to get a bowl here, but I may come back for Happy Hour appetizers..drinks normal priced were really cheap too, $5, & they have soju!  The bathroom is clean & cute too!
author: Cat C.

description: I came here at night with a group of friends. They close at 11pm, we got there around 10:30, they said last call was at that time. We felt really rushed.. I understand if you open till 11pm people should be able to order until that time. The ramen sucked! My boyfriend got the seafood ramen and the broth was so sweet.. They literally just boiled the seafood and put it with the broth. I got the tonkatsu ramen, the meat was cold! Literally tasted like they took it out of the fridge. The only thing that was good is there was no wait.
author: Christina T.

description: I've come to the conclusion, their Ramen is way too salty.
author: Helen L.

description:
One of my favorite places to come when I want ramen and I'm back at home. I used to come here all the time; it's still just as good as the day I started comin here. The food is very reasonably priced, and tastes pretty good. A bowl of ramen is like...$8 I think.

More recently when I've come here, I've tried other appetizers as well. Takoyaki's not bad (but not what I imagine great takoyaki to taste like) and the skewers can be hit and miss, but they're generally good.  Watermelon juice is nice and refreshing. Genki's ramen manages to scratch the itch if I get the craving and can't go out far somewhere like Ramen Dojo.

Service is usually pretty prompt when I'm here, but I think if it's more crowded service gets a bit more spotty. So far, I've had good luck. Let it continue!
author: Denise C.

description:
Happy hour $3 apps and beer
Got sesame wings, gyoza, and chicken karage. 
Glass of hef and asahi.
Ramen is decent.
Lots of tv around.
author: Linda T.

description:
Yummy karate ramen! Why is yelp controlling the length of my review? 

Chinese owned. But they got the foundations for a good Japanese.
author: One L.

description: Genki gets 4 stars because of their service,their good food, and staying open late. We returned late from out of town last Friday and we were hungry, do we drove a little out of our way here. The place was quiet but still had a good number of customers. We ordered the chasu ramen and chicken karaage ramen. SO GOOD!! It really hit the spot. The servers were all nice and attentive but not overly so. Thanks!!
author: Katie W.

description:
Genki is good... 
good about:
having just the right amount of options of ramen. not too many where im overwhelmed and doing more reading than chatting with who im at lunch with and they have enough where i feel like i have choices and not just stuck with like 3 options (HATE THAT!!!) 

i like that they have a lil get things for free by checking in on yelp, to me its the little things like that, which can make me really enjoy a restaurant. that and they were very attentive with refilling water and asking how things were. 

decor is really nice its very like up to date modern feeling.

they're chicken karaage is really good though!!! not dry and the right amount of batter with the right amount of crispiness! 

Genki is good, but not the best ramen ive had, and the fact that the server got my order wrong was also a negative...it might be my new pet peeve of mine but i really like when a server repeats your order just so both parties are on the same page.
author: Matt F.

description: $3 happy hour appetizers and drinks are the reason why I come to Genki.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Food was ok. Got the chasu ramen. But nothing is important if they don't honor their own deals. False yelp deals.

By the way, the "Samurai Wings" no good. So bland, eh. Can i get some more soy sauce please!
author: Albert W.

description:
I'm probably a bit too harsh on ramen (I'm not too impressed with Orenchi down in the South Bay), but oh well!

Don't get me wrong; there's nothing wrong with Genki. The ambience is very intricate, and the waiters are all very attentive and friendly. The food itself, however, is very standard. I ordered the spicy mabo with a side of gyoza. The spiciness of the soup was manageable, but it does creep up on you (just like bud light's strawberrita!), so that's always fun to experience. It wasn't overly salty either! I was impressed by that. But aside from that, everything was just standard. Nothing to take away from Genki, I wouldn't say I would never come back, but I would say don't expect anything more than standard ramen. It'll fill your tummy, but not your heart.
author: Eric N.

description: Be ADVISED, if you order from their website menu, the prices are, on average, about $2.00 less than what they end up charging you at the restaurant when you pick it up. They don't tell you when you order over the phone what your total is. Be sure to ask. I mentioned the problem to them and they dismissed it as "the website is old". Update it maybe??  BS - at the very least, a cheap trick.
author: Paul H.

description:
2.49 stars...

I wasn't impressed with the ramen, but i think it was too hyped up by friends as we drove there.  The char siu ramen was recommended, and i will say that the char siu was easily the best part of the ramen--you can order extra char siu if you want...which i would recommend. 

The noodles were nothing special, and some of the noodles were stuck together...not like a "they are so fresh and chewy and slightly sticky" stuck...more like "we pulled these out of a bag and they were compressed together and we didn't have enough time to let them separate in the soup before we served you" stuck.

At the time of consuming the ramen, many of us were intoxicated, and it still didn't taste as good as places i've eaten at when i'm sober...not a good sign.

There was a Yelp special where if you check in you get a free Chicken Karaage or Edamame or something like that...be sure to take advantage of that...Free is Free!

Happy Eating!
author: Bradley H.

description: Went to restaurant during open hours (over a half hour before posted closing time) and was turned away. Seemed like blatant profiling. Won't be back.
author: Jon Y.

description:
My friend and I didn't really know what to expect when we went to Genki Ramen last night.  This place is right next to one of my old watering holes.  We figured they were still open at 10:30pm so we might as well eat something before drinking a beer or two more.

We had five minutes to order.  I guess they were closing soon.  Ten minutes later we finally got to order.  The food gets delivered much faster than being able to order.  The food was nice and hot.

I ordered the Chashu Ramen.  The chasu was good, but I wasn't a big fan of the broth.  The noodles for the ramen OK.  I usually never finish my noodles, but I ate all mine.  I think I liked the texture.  It was different from other ramen noodles.  We also had the Chicken Karage Appetizer.  It was FREE by checking in with Yelp through my iPhone.  Free is always good!!!  My buddy got the Chicken Karage Ramen.  I think he liked it.  This place ain't bad.  I like the fact their menu is different from other ramen places.  I think I'll go back and give them another shot.
author: Jules S.

description: Drove by this place once and it looked good. .. so I came back one night to give it a try.  Absolutely worth it.  The food was great and not that expensive.  I will definitely be coming back.
author: Bella C.

description:
I ordered the Chashu ramen with extra chashu & extra noodles, Crispy Daimuru, and Gyoza through GrubHub last night. The crispy Daimuru was delicious and different, something I had never tried before but would definitely order again. 

The ramen was disappointing to me though. Maybe I'm spoiled by my regular place, but half a container of broth with "extra" noodles and chashu looked and ate like less than what I regularly get elsewhere without ordering extra. Maybe the broth container spilled in the car, but there was nothing to indicate such a thing happened (no spills, wet containers, etc.). Either way, if you're only going to serve a little bit of broth, don't tease me by putting in a container 2x as big as necessary, and if the broth did spill, maybe go back and get me a refill before delivering it to my house.

The gyoza was great as well, although the pastry (?) was a bit different than what I'm used to. I agree that the portions are small, and it seemed like $30 was an excessive amount for what I got, especially since delivery was free.

I probably won't return on my own, but I'd go back if someone else wanted to check it out.
author: Tonya I.

description: My son took me here for the first time and I ordered the mushroom ramen. I added bean sprouts, and stir fried vegetables and have to say it was THE BEST vegetarian ramen ever!!! The flavor was thru the roof! I will definitely be back for more!!!
author: Cindy T.

description: Somehow I always get the Chashu ramen when I come here. In my opinion it's pretty tasty and the broth is not too salty like some places. Bonus points for the check in deal, but overall It's a nice place for a quick ramen fix.
author: Renee Y.

description: Went to Genki Ramen a few weeks ago and thought I'd write them a review. I was hesitant to cheat on my regular Ramen place in Saratoga, however, I decided to check out Genki Ramen. Boy, did I become a fan! I really enjoyed the Tan Tan Men Ramen and Chicken Curry Katsu Ramen. The broth was rich with flavor and the chicken was perfectly cooked. Something different than your average ramen joint, it's quite a fusion of several things put together to formulate a delicious ramen. Definitely a "must try" place for everyone!
author: Saurabh S.

description:
The food should get 3-4 stars, which makes this place that much worse.  The service is so terrible (the same female waitresses have worked here forever) that I can never go back.  They are flat out rude.  Too bad for them.  

Halu, just a few blocks away is a much better choice, as are any number of places on Geary.

I'll never go back.  Too bad for them.
author: Scott L.

description: 5 Stars not in comparison to fancy places but for what it is. Looks nice and clean inside. Service was super friendly always a smile and I got my orders very quick. Exactly what I expected and I liked it a lot and for that "little" (cheap for SF for sure) money I will for sure go there again. You can probably drive some place else or/and pay more for better but deffo don't have to;)
author: Ilias S.

description:
Genki Ramen is my one and only favorite go to spot for ramen.

What do I recommend??? EVERYTHING!

If eggplant with sesame sauce sounds good (and it is) try Nasu Gomaae.

Street parking sucks, but that hasn't stopped me from coming back here again and again and again...
author: Sylvia O.

description:
This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The food here is consistently phenomenal and the service is friendly and attentive.

I have tried almost all the dozen or so types of ramen and have never had a bad bowl.  My current favorite is the butter and corn ramen, but the chasu is awesome as well.  If you can handle the heat I would highly recommend adding spicy miso to your bowl.  I also always get the silky tofu and its amazing.

Outside of ramen everything else is really good as well.  All the apps are awesome, but my faves are the takoyaki, perfectly cooked and sauced, the damaru tofu and croquets are great as well.  I also can highly recommend the fried rice, either chasu or seafood both rock.

I have eaten here dozens of times and never had even an average meal its always awesome.  I've eaten at all the "best" ramen places in the city and this place beats most of them and is at least on par with the others at a much friendlier price point.
author: David S.

description: Fire Roman went in there with my fam I ordered the tan-tan which was amazing my sister negi beef I got a taste and it was very delicious as well my mother ordered the veggie curry another great choice i can't wait to go back
author: Fredy V.

description: I really enjoyed the pork ramen with the chicken wings on the side. The broth was not too salty like some ramen places. I didn't drink alcohol but it seems like a good place to get some sake as well.
author: Joshua C.

description:
I've come here for a lunch a few times and never really had to wait for a seat. Their lunch specials are pretty cheap, so definitely take advantage of that. I've tried the Butter and Corn Ramen, Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen, and Nori Ramen (not all at once!). The ramen was good and was a decent portion. 

It's not my favorite ramen place, but it'll get the craving satisfied. 

The service is kind of slow though whether they are busy or not. It shouldn't take THAT long to ask us what we want to drink. 

This is probably the only place where I've heard the Nsync station on Pandora that wasn't my house. Hah.
author: Kathy L.

description: Just disappointed in there gratuity charges. They will charge you 28% percent for five people sitting and also don't ever get the butter soup ramen, it is not good over buttered. They try to be considerate about tipping but seriously they came back twice to demand the tip. That's pretty embarrassing and ridiculous. Tipping isn't mandatory unless I feel like I have a big party. Five people isn't a big party we ordered a ramen each and didn't order extra drinks.
author: David M.

description:
really good ramen! the spicy pork ramen was soo good I would have given it a 4 but the service and appetizers weren't really that great 

the Sui Mai was really small for $5 they were like the size of quarters. 

service was kind of slow too but they weren't even busy they just didn't check in with you as much they also forgot to give us our Sui Mai, we had to remind them and it seemed like it didn't take long to make they just forgot about our order basically 

but good place to go for ramen! 

went there for the second time and got the seafood ramen and found plastic around my crab... that's so disgusting!! and they took so long just to grab our order or even ask us if we wanted water or anything!!
author: Lyn C.

description: I LOVE coming to Genki Ramen, for two reasons, the affordable ramen and the flavor of their broth. I have yet to try the best ramen in San Francisco, but I do love coming here. I always order the original Chasu Ramen and enjoy that EVERY time, but when I bring friends, they love the Tenderous Ribs or the Curry Ramen. Can't go wrong with any of them. PLUS, they open late :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Delicious ramen and yakisoba. Comfortable atmosphere. Never disappoints. This is my go to ramen spot in San Francisco.
author: Tamara D.

description:
Genki is a personal and family favorite, and its not just about the ramen - everything they have we like.  Food is well priced (us plus 3 kids can eat for under $50), service is pretty speedy, it's family friendly... what's not to like?  I'd probably actually give them a 4.5* if possible, as I think the service could use a little improvement.

The curry chicken ramen is my personal favorite - full bodied, not too spicy (though a little sriracha is nice), huge portions, good noodles.  Recently tried the beef & onions ramen as well - might become the new standard!

Other things we love:
* Gyoza/potstickers - light & awesome
* Okonomiyaki - not necessarily authentic, but a great dish
* Yakitori - great little balance dishes to the ramen

As an added bonus - they take extra care for to-go orders, packaging the different components properly so nothing gets cold/soggy/wilted as you bring it home...
author: Jeremy T.

description:
OMG!! These people (Opal in particular) are so F-ing rude!!!! I call in an order, I'm told it will take 15 minutes, I arrived 30 minutes after my original call. My ramen wasn't ready... I'm told it will take 5 minutes. Then I'm told the cook didn't even make the ramen!!! REALLY?!?!? WTF! Now I'm told it will take another 30 minutes (this is after I have already paid). I told her I could not wait and wanted my money back. She then refused to refund my money and told me I needed to signed the receipt agreeing to pay for food I DID'NT EVEN GET!!!!!!!! I asked her for the manager's name and a way to contact them, she replied "manager isn't here". OBVIOUSLY!  

If it was possible to give NEGATIVE STARS I totally would give this place 5 NEGATIVE STARS!!!

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME MONEY OR PATIENCE ON THIS DIRTY PLACE!!!!
author: Danielle W.

description: Food was great but service was terrible! We went with a large group and they literally locked us in.. My boyfriend and I paid already but they wouldn't let us out. We had to wait as they reluctantly unlocked the door... That's ridiculous!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
It was my first time eating there. I ordered curry ramen but wasn't told that there are two options: dry and regular curry with broth. The waitress brought the dry curry noodles to the table so I asked her if there's anyway it can be redone because this is not the "curry noodles" I want... and I wasn't told there are two kinds of curry noodles.. She replied: "We have to charge you". 

....

.........
