I'm on the fence whether or not I'll be back.
author: Helen D.

description:
The rating is solely on the ramen itself. Seriously, I've had better. The broth was sadly bland and the chasu pork didn't impress. 

Service was nice and friendly and the decor was attractive, however I will not be coming back again, not for ramen at least.
author: Johanna P.

description: Id give them a zero for the worst service ever.  We didnt even order after waiting 20 min while everyone around us was served.  Never go here.
author: Troy C.

description: I love this place! I usually get the chashu ramen with an extra egg and kimchi and it's great. I would definitely recommend getting the bacon wrapped asparagus and steak wrapped green onions as appetizers. There are TVs too, so you could watch a game while eating.
author: Brian M.

description:
I didnt have the ramen, because to be honest ramenis a lot like Pho and i am hungry again in two hours.  I had the Katsu Curry with Rice.  It hit the spot and perfectly cook, but be careful because it comes out extremely hot.  

Check in with yelp to get a free appetizer
author: John T.

description:
One day last week I found myself in the Richmond around lunchtime, between appointments and craving ramen. Did I turn to my trusty Yelp app on the iPhone? Well, not quite...I sent a txt to my buddy Euge L. and in his broke Euge-ish (*tm) he sent me some rambling txts back. Finally the one that made the most sense was GENKI RAMEN. So I popped in for a bowl.

The Chashu ramen came with big chunks of porky goodness as well as half an egg, bamboo shoots and onion. The bowl was pretty huge and I thought for sure I'd have leftovers but it was so good I ate the whole thing.

In and out in probably 25 minutes for a grand total of around $10. Not sure it Genki is worth a trek across town but if you're in the area and craving ramen, it's a pretty damn solid option. Thanks, Euge!
author: phil h.

description:
Solid ramen, with a nice modern look and feel to the restaurant. But the wait times can sometimes be a little excessive (especially when you are one of the only groups in there.) and they play some music that seems to clash with the ambiance of the place and the general idea of a ramen house - but that could just be me.
One of the better ramen places I've been to and it ranks in my top five for SF.
author: Scott O.

description:
I go here for a very specific item:

GARLIC TENDROUS RIB RAMEN

I know there are tons of options, as well as lots of sides (that are all good on their own), but those ribs....

So. Delicious.

Perfect seasoning level, and the texture of the ribs is so unique that I crave this on a regular basis.

AND THEY DELIVER. Yes, it's just as good when delivered.

If you're going to get delivery, get some of the cute little sides that are like 1-2 bucks each. There's one that my friend that lives in Japan makes fun of with the term "cheesy dick" or something (essentially a tube of meat product of some kind filled with cheese, I think?), but it's so good it's worth the nickname and humiliation I experience when I told her what I ordered.
author: Cody K.

description:
Spicy Mabo Tofu Ramen. Wow. It's amazing. 
The staff is always friendly and prompt, the food is consistently good and the restaurant is clean. This isn't a fancy place for date night, but it's so good for a rainy-day caloric indulgence.
author: Es F.

description:
I've had the delivery-- Chicken Kara-age Ramen with Boiled egg.

The broth, not too salty and perfectly warmed up and I love that their isn't as much salt.

The chicken.. Yuck! Only crisp, too big to be chewy, and no taste. Made me drink a lot of water to wash down the sodium taste. I should have gotten chicken Katsu.. Lol.

The seaweed, and corn are my favorite parts. The ramen is cooked about right, but is a little more.. Raw than chewy. I enjoyed that. Weird, right? 

So far, I will come here again but definitely NOT for the chicken kara-age!
author: Crystal C.

description: Need to work on there customers service. Why give a menu when it's over in 5 min and take them 10 min come back to take your order..
author: dave w.

description:
Genki Ramen... 

I'm not quite sure what to say about this place, but that I enjoy their food.  I think they could fix some of their broken sofa though...
author: Tina L.

description:
I love this place. I'm taking all of my friends here. 

Food:
Great portions, reasonable prices.

Service:
Smiles, good service, and smiles!

I am a foodie, I don't care if its high quality, as long as it has decent quality and taste. Im all for it. AND I LOVE THIS PLACE.

All of my friends say nothing but good things about this place. There's a giant menu right outside so you can just take a quick look before entering. The restaurant itself is pretty clean, wide and spacious. Good for lunch if yuo ask me. It's nice empty and quiet. Not that they don't get business but I like eating in quiet restaurants. They do have tvs but they put on the weirdest shows. Health related shows I believe.

BUT DEFINITELY GIVE THIS PLACE A CHANCE. If you like Kushi tsuru ramen, and if you like Suzu's ramen, you will like this place.
author: Cynthia D.

description: Good pork ramen, nice gyozas and tasty hot sake.
author: John D.

description:
Food was OK. You can find better Ramen somewhere else. 

My hangup...

Please find waitress and waiters who SPEAK ENGLISH

When I called to make a reservation, I seriously could not understand a word the person on the other end was saying. To be honest I wasn't even sure I made a reservation!!!

I am Japanese and the people here are asian, but seriously learn english. It was really frustrating.

Huge Pro: if you check in on Yelp you get a free appetizer. score.
author: emily f.

description: Love their chicken karage ramen. Flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles. If you check in, you get a free chicken karage appetizer. Portions are big and food is consistently good. Another plus is that there is usually no wait and the restaurant is spacious.
author: Peggy L.

description:
Undoubtedly Delicious.
But the restaurant & the ramen are not very traditional per se, it's more fusion/modern (not that I have been to Japan, but I've had a decent amount of Japanese food/ramen). 
Anyways I am vegetarian and I usually get the Japanese curry ramen. 
Fact of the matter is that I'm obsessed with Japanese curry so to find a curry flavoured ramen was groundbreaking to me. 
My only complaint really is that it's extra to add egg to your ramen and they are very "well done", as in completely cooked through, I'm not used to that from all the other ramen I've eaten & kind of dislike it. 
But I like the atmosphere It's very modern, fun & nicely lit. Top 40/poppy soundtrack which is kind of weird but also fun. 
& At the end when you pay for your bill, instead of mints they give you hi-chews :)!
They stay open pretty late too, which is boss!
author: Zhenya S.

description: Ramen is still good but do not order the deep fried tofu!  $4 for four small pieces of tofu--not worth it!!
author: C L.

description:
This is my go-to place for ramen in San Francisco
mainly cause this is one of the few places that 
has Mabo Tofu Ramen and the only place that does it right
I know it's not very traditional ramen but I find it delicious
Not that spicy, a great serving of tofu and ground pork
I like it cuz its a fusion of Chinese cuisine and Japanese Ramen
nomnomnom 
and that's just the food, the service has always been good if not 
great every time I've been there, I once had a party there and 
they were very good about accommodating, sure there was a 
cake cutting fee or whatever, but I find it to be worth it
The interior is very nice, lots of TVs, plus a nice vibe
Also they seem to have a lot of  nice perks for checking in on Yelp there
Make sure to check out the bathroom before you leave
it's pretty sweet for a non-boojee restaurant.

The Spicy Mabo Ramen makes me Genki-desu!!
author: Vince D.

description:
Genki Ramen is a great place to eat.

To start, the food is quick and delicious. Their chicken karaage and chicken katsu (with or without curry) are delicious. I've been there a number of times and the food comes out within 5-10 minutes, but I've been there mostly with a small party.

Next, the service was fairly good. I've managed to get what I want when I want it very quickly. There were some rough patches, but overall, it was pretty good. One time, my friend left their bag in the restaurant and one of the waitresses chased us down a block and a half just to give us our bag. I would consider that above standards.

Lastly, Genki isn't super expensive. I find that their price matches their quality, which is what people want. I would recommend it to people looking for ramen in the city. 

P.S. I like how Genki actually plays "modern" music, which I don't find too often in restaurants in SF.
author: Nick L.

description:
All i can say is that, i'd drive all the way to the city just to have my ramen. i'd do this at least once a month or every other month. 

there's something about their Garlic Tenderous Rib; i can never get enough and it just keep me wanting and going back for more. now, i'm sure they have other delicious dishes, but this review is solely on this ramen! it's just one of the best ramen, taste and combination... so far. 

their service could be improve, just a-OK. parking sometimes..well most of the time.. is just pure luck. the area itself is just busy but my friends and i just come back here for this ramen.
author: Viola C.

description:
Let's jump right into it, the location is nice and well furnished but the service and the main event, ramen, are sub-par.  I've had some of the appetizers, and they're decent.

I've come several times and the ramen has always underwhelmed me but I have to share what happened the last time I came.  First, we ordered two ramens, one kim-chi ramen, and one curry katsu ramen.

The kim-chi ramen was so underflavored that it tasted like a normal miso ramen with a few kim-chi cabbage leaves thrown it.  Even then, the broth was watered down and ended up tasting like salty water.  Truly disappointing - 1 star.

The curry katsu ramen that my girlfriend, who is Japanese, got had a well done chicken katsu on top but suffered from the same sad fate as my kim-chi ramen in that there was a spoonful portion of curry that just diluted into the watered down broth so it tasted nothing like curry.  When she asked the waiter to get more curry, the waiter tried to charge us $4 for a cup of curry that should have been in the ramen in the first place.  We had to argue with her to finally get her to get us a cup of curry to "fix" the ramen.  1-star.

For a ramen place that seeks to evoke authentic Japanese cooking, Genki utterly fails.  If I were the chef and sent this food out to customers, I would consider committing sepuku for the dishonor and shame I bring upon the restaurant and my family.
author: Brutally H.

description:
A favorite go-to spot for a late dinner (with happy hour specials). Decent selection of ramen with a list of everything you can add on the side, letting you create your own combination ramen (kimchi ramen with extra pork and beef). 

The okonomiyaki is a must, especially in a group. This was the first time I've tried it but I expected it wouldn't be too far off from Korean pancakes (very small differences but I still prefer the Korean). Friends that have more experience with it though said it wasn't bad here except they undercooked it once out of the three times which left us with a soggy mess.
author: Justin P.

description: Best cold noodles I've tried in a long time. Had the veggie cold ramen and the combination of the japanese mayo on the noodles mixed with avocado, tomato, and tofu created the perfect creamy, yet refreshing dish. The texture of the noodles was also impressive as they had just enough bite to them. Would definitely come back to try their other ramen dishes.
author: Kailin L.

description:
Came to Genki Ramen with no expectations and was surprised by the meal my friend and I had the Chicken Karaage Ramen which was perfect concerning flavor and its contents! The ramen noodles had a chewy texture which I enjoyed, the broth was flavorful (I just wish that they gave more broth than they did), and the Chicken Karaage was delicious! We shared a Sumo (bacon and cheese) Okonomiyaki which was strangely delicious! 

The service however could be improved. Although some of the servers were friendly, no one came back to check on us or to refill our drinks.

I would definitely return! After an upsetting encounter with the main server at Ramen Dojo, Genki Ramen is our ramen savior!
author: Juliette R.

description:
It's seriously about time I write a review for this place...I always seem to end up here!! They have delicious ramen, more specifically I always get the garlic tenderous rib ramen....mmmm!! The meat falls off the bone and tastes amazing.

They also have great sesame fried chicken!! So yum :D
author: B B.

description:
Nothing spectacular here, except that you get a free appetizer when you check in through Yelp. My friend and I ended up sharing the potato croquette, which was just basically fried potato pancake.. I don't think I would order it next time though. 

There were lots of different flavors for the ramen. I ended up customizing mine, since I wanted butter corn and tonkatsu broth. The waitress was very accommodating and said that it was doable. However, the broth and the ramen is just not nearly as good as Ramen Dojo in San Mateo. It's about the same price also (minus the wait), so I think I would just go to Ramen Dojo next time. As others have mentioned, the broth isn't really rich in flavor as a tonkatsu base should be. The ramen was more soggy that I'm used to. Overall, not that bad - but definitely not the best bowl of ramen I've had.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I know five stars!? I was surprised myself when I sat down to type this out. But after trying for five minutes to think of a downside to Genki, I decided to hell with it! FIVE STARS! 
After trying Izakaya Sozai (which was ok) my boyfriend and I were so excited to find a ramen place just as good (perhaps even better) where we didn't have to wait an hour for a table, deal with snooty waiters, and only have one ramen choice. 
Behold the beauty that is Genki Ramen. We've gone twice already both on a weekend night for dinner (around 8-9) and never waited more than 15 min. The selection of ramen is INCREDIBLE! We always order out own bowl (even though the portions are hefty) and try a new one each time. Of the four that we have devoured so far, THEY HAVE ALL BEEN INCREDIBLE! Which makes it hard to switch it up because you wanna stick with it it's so tasty. Servers aren't overly friendly but at least they don't cop an attitude. 
Overall, Genki is great and just may become our go to ramen place! 
Tried so far : chicken katsu curry ramen, shoga niku, beef stew ramen, and the tender garlic rib ramen. ALL DELICIOUS!
author: Gaby R.

description:
I woke up starving after a long day of hanging out in Golden Gate Park and so my friend brought me to this local Inner Richmond joint.  I fell in love, and have been back once more since then.  

I ordered the Tender Garlic Rib Ramen and it was divine.  The broth was extremely flavorful, and it was served with crispy fried garlic, a soy sauce egg, and spinach.  Perfection! My friend always orders the Negi Beef Ramen - the broth has more of a soy sauce flavor because the beef and vegetables are stir-fried first. I also really enjoyed her dish.  

On my second visit, we went for a late night meal and they had Happy Hour prices ($3) for some of their appetizers.  I highly recommend the gyoza as they are perfectly crisped and served with the traditional, yet extra delicious soy, vinegar dipping sauce. I also had a Watermelon Juice which was more like a slushy, but it was very refreshing and sweet - definitely fresh.    

I highly recommend this location for an unpretentious, affordable, and delicious meal.
author: Kristine P.

description:
Usually Come here with the BF for Happy Hours.
4 stars for happy hours.
3 stars for dinner. Food are just ok, and a little bit pricey. 
Genki Ramen,  Ramen suppose to be really good but not really. 

The happy hours is from 3-6pm , 10 to close I think.  $3 menu! :)
author: Niko L.

description:
So far my favorite place for ramen. I like the soup, the noodles were never too soggy or firm. I also really liked the mango salad with crab meat.
The service here is never that great, but the food here is yummy.

As a warning, this place uses a crap load of either msg or just salt because after eating here I always wake up in the middle of the night and down a glass of water. Can't be good for you, but I love salty food =)
author: Jenn T.

description: Genki is a great neighborhood spot.  Your dollar goes a long way. The Mango Salad is always fresh and the crab meat is generous.  While the ramen is great I am a huge fan of the Yakisoba noodles.  The Chashu is my favorite and you will have leftovers to take home.  They will make it spicy on request.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.
author: Ben V.

description:
This place is good for decent ramen cravings. Nothing compared to the San Mateo ramen joints. It has a recent selection of ramen, but you know it cannot be a great ramen shack due to the range of dishes including rice and curry dishes. A TV at this place is a plus, to enjoy the occasional Giants win or 49ers game. Most weekday nights there is not a wait, but sometimes a short wait does queue up.

I do not think the soup base is natural (e.g. pork bones, like Santa's), and is most likely supplemented with MSG and other flavoring. Cravings for water often follow a bowl of ramen.

One of the better noodle choices in San Francisco, but disappointing overall.
author: Jason T.

description:
I highly recommend Genki Ramen. Fantastic prices, nice atmosphere and a great place to come when your with friends...maybe a date? haha but I came here a while back with friends and just now am I getting to write a review. Don't worry, I have notes from my iPhone so my review will be accurate. And I thank my friend Eddie cause I think he referred my us to come here.

I had the Garlic Tenderous Rib Ramen, which had sliced roasted garlic, pork soft bone, half boiled egg and spinach in tonkatsu base. Loved it. I love garlic! I really enjoyed this dish, and plus they have other options on the menu, I just happened to go with ramen I mean after all, their name says Genki Ramen so you can only assume they specialize in Ramen. The price was $.9.75 and well worth it. Aside from the Garlic Tenderous Rib Ramen I also ordered a side of Fried Tofu (I'm thinking Agadashi Tofu) and that was also very satisfying. It wasn't over fried and the soy sauce wasn't very salty either. Loved it!

Overal, they get a solid 4 stars. Excellent service, food, prices, portions. I wanna come back soon so I can get my RAMEN fix. :-) Oh and YES I'd bring a friend.
author: Roger C.

description:
Nothing super special, but when I want some relatively cheap chicken curry katsu, this is the place!

Service is good, prices are good, food is good. No complaints here.
author: Erica W.

description: Going downhill. Not greeted and wasn't offer the pickles. Have to print out coupon to get the promotional food. Noodle a bit hard.
author: John L.

description:
Soup is amazing, not that I need to tell you that, but it never hurts to let others know your true feelings on such an important subject. While it goes against my normally adventurous eating nature I have never had anything but the ramen soup at genki, but for good reason. It's delicious. Whether its the garlic tenderloins rub, the tonkatsu curry, or the mushroom I have yet to have a bad bowl of soup here. It's not the absolute best ramen I've ever had but it is definitely above average, and I would recommend it to any fellow soup enthusiast. 

P.S. my most recent obsession has been watermelon juice, and genki ramen's is amazing.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Not that impressed overall. Disappointed might be a better word, actually.

We were in the neighborhood yesterday around 2 PM starving and looking for something not too terribly unhealthy to eat. We saw this place, checked out the menu and decided it looked good.

The best I can say is that it wasn't terrible. My husband had veggie yakisoba; the noodles were tasty, but the (lunch) portion was on the smaller side, and there just weren't really many veggies in it. The menu said there was asparagus in it, which was a big selling point for him, but there was no asparagus in it at all. The veggies that were there were diced so fine or shredded that it was like no veggies at all almost. He was hoping for some big chunks of vegetables, since there was no meat. I don't know if the dinner-sized portions are significantly bigger, but I do know that he left kind of hungry. And while it wasn't super pricey, it also wasn't cheap enough to merit leaving hungry.

I had the kimoko (?) mushroom ramen. I did like the flavor of mine and the texture of the different mushrooms, and overall enjoyed eating it. However, as with my husband's, the portion size was just a little too small for the price. Again, maybe it is because it was the lunch portion, but at Hotei down the street from our house you can get a bowl of ramen twice the size for the same price or even less, at any time of day. Plus Hotei has more variety of noodles, etc.

I got the gyozas with the ramen for $1 extra (part of the lunch special) and they were OK but nothing to write home about...not to mention being very, very small. I was glad to get them but also glad that I only paid $1 for them.

Finally, what really made the experience pretty "meh" was the service. I hate to badmouth people and I don't give many negative reviews in general, but the service really left much to be desired. No one was rude or anything, but it took a good 10 minutes or so before anyone came to our table to take our order (even a drink or appetizer order), and we were starving; when we were ready to go, it took a while to catch the waitress's eye to get our check, and then it took forever for her to come pick up our card, so much that we were scrambling to find cash so we could just leave...and it was around 2:30-3:00 on a Monday afternoon, there were a couple of tables in the restaurant but I would hardly say they were busy, and I saw the waitresses standing around, so there was really no excuse. And again, no one was rude, but there was a very blase attitude going on there...a general I-don't-give-a-shit attitude.

Honestly I wouldn't go back. I'm interested in finding new ramen places but Hotei keeps looking better and better...
author: Jennie S.

description: Nice spot. Food is good. During our visit the server seemed to rush us with placing the order. I hope servers SMILE more on my next visit. The place also gets a bit noisy. The good thing is that they have televisions all around showing sports. Overall this is a good restaurant and I will visit again.
author: Vadim S.

description:
went here for the first time on 01/07/2014 because my younger loves ramen and hey had good variety on their menu and it was great! dad had the beef curry ramen, sister had the miso ramen, while i had the vegetable yakisoba and they were all delicious. 

we got there around 2 pm and it was pretty empty, service was fast and attentive, got our food very quickly. parking wasn't that great but they cant be faulted for that since parking in san francisco is always awful.
author: Kate G.

description: There's no wait in line. Just came in and sat down right away. Food came out fairly fast. I had gotten the vegetarian ramen and my friend had the char siu pork ramen. We also ordered a side of seaweed salad. The portions were huge and we can barely finish it. Great quick dinner and fairly affordable. Servers were kind of attentive since no one was dining with us
author: Natalia D.

description: Really like this spot and it's my "go to" for noodles in the Richmond.  Service is nice and friendly, and it's super clean.  Once in awhile I have had a bad server but in general it wouldn't stop me from going again since I have had so many Postive experiences.
author: Tighe O.

description:
Excellent food with ok service.

I had the baked scallops, a bite of the lamb chop, and the chicken karaage ramen. The baked scallops are *very* hot when they come out, I would suggest putting them on your plate as soon as possible so they don't overcook in the mini cast iron skillet. They had a tasty garlic flavor. The lamb chop was so good, I forgot it was lamb. I usually hate the texture of lamb, but they cooked it to tender perfection and it lacked all traces of the slightly icky aftertaste I've had all the previous times I've had lamb. Finally the ramen, I thought the corn ramen combo would be weird, but the sweetness of the corn was a welcome balance to the slight saltiness of the broth.The only thing that could've made the ramen better is if I had remembered to request a hard boiled egg with it and if the chicken karaage had had a little more taste (it was missing a slight sweetness and a tad more salt).

The service isn't bad but it isn't spectacular either. They're pretty anxious to take your order, but then pretty much forget about you till you request the check.

I need to come back here to try the assortment of appetizers and other snacks on the menu. Thanks for another great suggestion JL!
author: Dani D.

description:
Living in Sunset SF all of my life, Genki Ramen is just one of those places everyone's pretty much gone to. Being that there are so few ramen shops in Sam Francisco, it is one of the few people eat at (and usually remember).

Before coming here, I've already been here a couple of times. Although I've never been impressed (since they've never had the WOW factor), they have never done that badly with their food. 

Ambiance - Very chillax. Definitely not the best "restaurant" mood. Being surrounded by like six TVs, the dark lighting and loud chatter screamed restaurant/bar like atmosphere. 

Service - Good job Genki Ramen! (for an Asian place!) There were multiple female waitresses that were constantly checking up on us and asking us if we needed anything. But most importantly, they were able to keep our water glasses pretty much filled - I'd say this is by far one of their more impressive factors. 

The food came out pretty fast, which was nice. I got the Katsu Curry Ramen, my sister got the Chashu Ramen, and her husband got the Chicken Yakisoba. [Just a heads up: Genki's may only have decent food, but they ARE one of the only few places that sell Japanese delicacies such as okonomiyaki, yakisoba, etc among the myriad of sushi restaurants in SF.] 

I was pleased with my food, it was a nice balance of crunchy Katsu, and rich curry soup. There food has been pretty consistent so coming here you definitely know you have consistency!

Overall: Nice late night place to grab some eats!
author: Calvin H.

description: I can't get enough of this place! The service is great and the ramen is even better.  I highly recommend the negi beef. The location couldn't be better...It's literally around the corner from my apartment. Definitely a must if you're ever near Geary!
author: Emily M.

description:
I don't get it.  The reviews are saying its good for the area, but shouldn't you people be reviewing in general?? I suppose if I'm desperate for Ramen RIGHT there, and the buses are all broken, my car is unavailable and my legs are too tired to walk to Japantown...maybe.

Came here with a bunch of friends on a cold SF day (really, what day isn't?).  Figured Ramen is a good choice because its warm, right?? My friend suggested Genki...and since I've never been but pass it all the time, I figure sure.  Now I realize its an experience I didn't really need to have.

We came in to a half-empty restaurant. The waitress told us to follow her and we did...to a table that was dirty. And we were like...ok.  She takes the time to clean it and shove the ajoining table together.  But we're standing in the walk way totally taking up room. Would have just been better if they cleaned it then asked us over.

We look at the menu's provided, and after deciding, we close the menus...with everyones menu's closed, its a clear sign we're ready to order. They didn't catch the hint.  In fact, a couple walked in AFTER us, and got their orders taken BEFORE us. I had to wave a waitress down. Points off.

We all order our foods. I got Chasu Ramen, and changed to Miso base for no extra charge (yay!).  BUT. Our orders came really far apart from one another. Weirdly, the first and the last order she took down was the first to come. One other came 5 minutes later. And 5 minutes after that, my order and my friends order came last.  Points off.

Food-wise, its average.  The soup base had little flavor.  Maybe it was just me.  Portion and size wise, it was average.  The ramen was a good consistency.  Size was perfect for average hunger.

I think if the waitstaff was better, I'd give it a 3 at least. Food was really average.  If I wanted good ramen, I'd trek to Santa. Omiting the ability to do so, I'd go Tanpopo in J-town.
author: Lily W.

description: Decent Raman, good prices and a nice place to eat and watch ballgame.  The wait staff is very nice and they keep it simple.  No frills really, but if you want to easily scratch that Raman itch this is the easiest place to go.  Open late too!
author: Anthony D.

description:
Spicy Mabo Tofu Ramen... yummy! 5 stars for that.

Kimchi Ramen... meh. 3 stars for that.

Overall 4 stars for me right now. Decently priced and wasn't overly crowded on a Friday night. Me likey. Definitely will come back to try other stuff on the menu!
author: Timothy L.

description:
I never write yelp reviews but wow, Genki you have terrible delivery and customer service.  It's happened before, so shame on me this time.  But I will tell you all how to get a free coke out of it.

At 8:00pm I call for delivery service, I place my order and don't think twice about it.  At 9:15pm there's still no sign of order, so I call the restaurant:

Genki: Hello?

Me: Hi there, I ordered my food over an hour ago and wanted to check if it went out or not?

Genki:  It will be there in ten minutes.  It's on the way.

Me:  Um, do you even know who this is? 

(I give her my info just in case)

Genki:  It's on the way.

Me:  Perfect, thanks.

At 9:50pm there is still no food and I call back:

Genki:  Hello?

Me:  Hi, where is the food for house number _________?  You said it would be ten minutes thirty-five minutes ago.

Genki: Your food is still here, sorry.  It's leaving now though.

Me:  Was it just cooked or is the food cold?

Genki:  Would you like us to heat it up for you?

Me:  What?!  The food IS cold?  If it's been sitting there I don't want it.

Genki:  It's not cold, and it's leaving right now.

At 10:00pm they show up and because it took so long they threw in a free coke and I'm like whatever great. The total is $21 and some change.  I hand over $25 expecting change but they say thank you and pocket my money.  And then she looks at the bag and says "Oh they forgot to put your miso sauce in here, I'll be right back" and then runs to the car and bolts.  I'm standing there like WTF?

I bring the food in and open it up and the fried meat is soggy and COLD.

So now I'm livid at this point and call them back and demand my money back and that they can keep their shitty food and before I can even really complain they were like "Ok" and hung up.

The delivery lady comes back and plays dumb saying "Here is your sauce" and smiles.  I just politely say "I'd just like my money back" and her smile turns to a frown as she hands me my money in exchange for cold food.

As I'm handing her the coke she puts her hand up and says "You can keep the coke, don't worry about it, it's no problem" and repeats it again.  I'm not sure if  that was a cue for a "Thank you" from me as I looked at her with a blank stare but hey if you want a free coke from Genki this is one way to do it.

DO NOT DO THE DELIVERY UNLESS YOU AREN'T HUNGRY AND ARE OUT OF COKE.
author: Marcus U.

description: The Hamachi Kama was grilled perfectly, juicy and crispy. The onigiri unagi grilled had a little too much sauce for my taste. Also, The chicken katsu curry was good too.
author: Iggy H.

description: I was going to give this place 2 stars because the ramen was okay at best. The broth was salty and just tastes cheap. It was okay. But what really bothered me was the giant rat that scurried across the booth next to me and then behind some boxes by the kitchen.  Nope.
author: Jessica O.

description:
Cold, foggy and hungry...sounds like a good time for some ramen!

Came for lunch. Unusually empty (guess they're most busy at night?) with a plethora of wait staff, but no one seems to be working. Waited for a while before someone came to take our order.

Good thing they have some killer ramen, otherwise the service would totally turn me off from this place. After ordering our ramen came out FAST!

Ordered the garlic tenderous rib. OMG soooo good! Loved the broth and the toasted garlic. Noodles were a good consistency and had great flavor.

This will be a great place to come for lunch on cold days!
author: Christy L.

description:
The food is fairly tasty and the portions are sizable, but the service has been terrible each and every time I have dined here.   The servers walk around with annoyed looks on their faces and sigh at the slightest request.  

+1 star because they deliver (you don't have to deal with the wait staff that way!)
author: Jessyca M.

description:
Finally after months & months of a very long wait and now it has finally ended!!! I wasnt really sure on when will I ever get a chance to go eat at Genki Ramen until today on a half days work at Stonestown, I had a very good chance of going to Genki Ramen for lunch on a beautiful sunny tuesday!!! After seeing the mouthwatering pictures of the food that was taken by the yelpers... When, I first arrived at Genki Ramen during the lunch time hour it was busy in the begininng but the waitress who took me in was able to find me a table really fast without waiting...This is what I have ordered when I got seated by the friendly waitress who was very helpful also I felt sorry for her because she was the only one working...

~~~So This Is What I Have Ordered From The Genki Ramen Menu~~~

Chahan Pork Fried Rice
2 Piece Croquettes
1 Coca Cola

Now that I finally had the chance to go eat at this Japanese Restaurant for the first time ever!!! I have to say I really like place alot... I would definitely would want come back again....
author: William B.

description:
i came here with a couple of my friends after a hard night of drinking a few weeks ago. we couldnt decide where to eat so i suggested this place cause i heard from other ppl about it....so we went there and as soon as we sit down, our alcoholic friend orders a fuckin IPA (this is like after killing 1.5 liter bottle and a lot of beers amongst the 4 of us the night before).....shit....were like "alright, WHY NOT! YOLO!" we ended up getting like 2 beers and 2 bottles of hot sake, but enough with alcohol

we all ordered Chasu ramen (think that was the house special ramen) with fried rice, and i also got chicken gizzard and karage off yelp check in....like a BOSS!

i really liked the chicken gizzard, it was salty and crispy, and i always enjoy that chicken gizzard texture, i liked the ramen, but it wasnt anything special, think i had better ramen before from other japanese ramen places, i REALLY liked the fried rice tho, u can thoroughly taste the animal fat mixed and rendered in with rice....hmmmm

overall i would give it 4 stars but 1)i wasnt super impressed with the main dish and 2) there were these stupid kids yelling and screaming and shit, at one point this chubbyass kid yelled out "MOMMMYYYY!" several times when we were trying to eat....

3.5 stars
author: Michael K.

description:
Genki Ramen is definitely one of the best ramen restaurants in the Richmond. They get 3 stars due to their poor service. 

The ramen soups are really good but definitely try the yakisoba. 

They do good take-out AND they deliver
author: Nicolas M.

description:
Horrible service! 
I will never come again here! Waitress are never smile; you will feel like in a prison eatery, waitress are walking around like prison guard, never will ask for water and will never say to you enjoy your meal; will never do eye contact when she serve you a meal. They will never smile to you but will laugh and talk in foreign language to each other. 
About food: We had a ramen noodle which tasted like water, the okonomiyaki taste was not bad actually but the size was too small. So one star for the okonomiyaki and zero for the service!
author: Nomad Warrior B.

description:
"Everything a gyoza should be."

Gyoza here is phenomenal. Ramen is really good, I've tried the garlic tendon rib and the beef stew. Both really good only qualm is the service. Takes a bit to get refills on water and you have to ask for refills.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I didn't have very high expectations for a ramen place that opens as late as genki ramen but i was definitely pleasantly surprised! The ramen here is actually pretty good. I also really liked the watermelon juice =)
author: Annie Z.

description:
The first time I came here was last year.  It was after a wedding...open bar....so I don't remember how the ramen was.  I decided to try it again last month after I got off the plane from Vegas.  I was wanting something hot and soupy, and ramen was the pick of the night.

Not too many people dining on a Sunday night, so we got seated right away.  We ordered the chicken karaage for an appetizer( http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/haFELgP5srdQ0QqYb4GsWQ/l ).  I got the butter and corn ramen with chashu( http://static4.px.yelp.com/bphoto/pR6yUqtD-TmOrXZOflEBQg/l ) and my friend got the shrimp tempura ramen( http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/p3oNtwm1hQst66MQ4Aq5RQ/l ).

The chicken karaage was yummy.  It was nice and crispy and seasoned just right.  The ramen was good, but I still haven't found a favorite ramen joint yet.  The chashu was nice and tender, and the noodles had a good chewy consistency.  The broth was good, but after a while, it seemed a little on the salty side.

Overall, this is a decent ramen place with reasonable prices.  I'll be back when I don't feel like driving to the peninsula to get my ramen fix.
author: Patra I.

description:
Bad and dirty food!! The taste is good because of MSG. They put a bunch of MSG in the food and you can't avoid it. If you're allergic to MSG, you can't dine in here because they put in everything. It's not traditional Japanese food. The owner is Chinese. 

They usually cook soup in advance and cool it down at the back room. I kinda accidentally saw it and someone was carrying the mop and crossing it over the big pot of soup!?!?!?!?!?! No wonder if you had been dining in in here and few days later you got food poisoning, no wonder!! A lot of pathogen going on here!!! That is terrible!!!

I will never go back there again. There's a bunch of Japanese restaurant full of quality, but not this one, totally!!! The food is soo oily. I got a lot of acne after I ate it. Even though they have free hi-chew, I wouldn't risk my life, only for hi-chew...I can buy it by myself!! 

It's not what I was thinking and expecting!!! There's a lot of thing to say more....

That's it!! Just enjoy if you still enjoy, but not me, no more!!!
author: Abbey L.

description:
Genki Ramen is a very decent ramen place. A bunch of my runner friends and I come here frequently and it's become a bit of a tradition. 

High Points:
--Yasai Ramen and Curry Veggie are very good ramen.
--Vegetarian broth is available! Not as flavorful, of course, but great to have the option.
--You get Hi-Chews with the bill :)
--They deliver... I think.
--they almost always have a CHECK IN DEAL on Yelp! Seriously, every time I have been there. Plus for that! The croquettes and edamame are my favorite appetizers I've tried. The tofu is bad.

Needs improvement:
--Speed of service varies.
--Occasionally someone at your table will be staring longingly at their quickly-cooling bowl of ramen while you wait ten more minutes for the second bowl to come out. This is a big no no.
--Consistency. Sometimes the broth is way less good than normal. The rice dishes and one plated noodle dish I had there were not great. 
--Credit card machine problems! Me and TWO of my friends have been double-charged, or something similar, here.

All in all I really like Genki. Stick with the ramen though.
author: Courtney A.

description:
So you apparently can't dine in after 10:30 when they close at 11. I'm a regular there and I think I'm not going to genki anymore after dealing with this crap twice.

Food is decent but fix your hours.
author: Abigail P.

description:
I've been here three times.  First time was great.  Second time, it was meh.  Tonight was the worst.  Each time, I ordered the beef okonomiyaki.  First time, it was delicious.  Crispy on the edges and nicely seasoned.  Second time, it was soggy and downright undercooked.  I thought it was just a fluke.  Third time, repeat of second.  

In addition, they didn't bring out my food until my wife was done with hers, and that's after I asked about where it was.  The waitress plops it down and walks away.  Wow.  "No sorry for waiting" or "it was really busy in there."  At least my wife's ramen was edible.  The chicken karaage was very dry.  

I knew it was a bad omen when the Giants lose to Rockies.  I will not be back.
author: Stan V.

description: I was told that they serve an exalted dish called takoyaki.  Octopus stuffed balls of fury they were, topped with dried shrimp.  Full disclosure: Reverse Happy Hour from 10pm-close gets you these bad boys for $3.  Also, check-in offers are a major plus.  #Word.  I fell upon a cure for daytime drinking this very night as well.  Ready for it?  A hefty bowl of ramen accompanied with a watermelon juice slushie to take you into a marvelous food coma so you can dream about sharing this same meal with Siddhartha under the meditation tree.  Go, enjoy, be merry.
author: Angie N.

description: Piece of shit customer service! Don't come here. They're all about paying the bills and keeping the lights on, which I'm sure they won't very long. If you want lip service and $1 ramen noodles then try. Wouldn't let me rate ZERO STAR.. #ShutdownRamen
author: S. L.

description:
I've been going to Genki for ramen a couple times a month for about four months and it's always been great, so I'm giving them two stars (I'm already starting to feel like *that* guy), but something happened recently that probably means I'll never go back.

Again, their ramen is good and pretty cheap (definitely get something with the tonkatsu base), their apps and robotayaki and okonomiyaki are all good, too.

The last time I was there, I ordered a small hot sake.  They brought it out, I poured it into my cup, and there were a bunch of dead flies in it.  (If you don't know, fruit flies are attracted to sake and if you leave it out, they flock to it - essentially, they gave me old sake that had been uncovered and left to sit somewhere)

I was a chef for a few years and if I ever served something like that and someone showed it to me, I would have been mortified and I would have replaced it and comped it (at least).  

I showed it to a waitress and sent it back.  She said "oh, sorry" and took it back to show whoever was prepping the sake.  Twenty long minutes went by before I got a new one and in the meantime, everyone working in the back was now staring at me, like I planted the flies or something.  They did not comp it. (I wasn't expecting them to or anything, even though I would have)

As much as I like their food, I'm not going to go to a place that doesn't seem to care when they serve you flies.  I'm sure they'll be more careful and no one else will have to worry about it, but they ruined the way I, personally, view them.  Take from this what you will.
author: Gavin S.

description:
I'm extremely picky with ramen having grown up in an area with tons of Japanese food & people. I ordered the chasu ramen. The only thing I liked about this place was the flavor of the broth, tho it was very greasy. The noodles were average. The meat was very dry & everything tasted bland. Because I went at lunch time, I ordered the lunch special, so I added the chahan to my order of ramen. I had hopes that it would be good because most Japanese fried rice is good, but this was a huge disappointment. The rice was very heavy on grease & had no flavor at all. I had to ask for a side of ginger to give it more flavor, but even the ginger was bad. I tried my boyfriends karaage & that didn't taste good at all either. The frying at this place needs some work. 
If I have anything good to say about this place is that the prices are decent & they have a wide selection of dishes to choose from. Personally, I would not come here again or recommend it to friends. I prefer ajisen ramen over this place.
author: Janey H.

description:
I decided to give it a try and it was great!  Its not the best, but the service was nice and its cool that I didn't have to wait hours for ramen.  I really liked their selection, which kinda veered into the kind of ramen I usually make at home, but they make it better!

They have stuff like ma po tofu ramen, seafood ramen, ramen ramen haha.  I like the broth, a very typical tonkatsu flavor.  My mom had miso which lived up to expectation as well.  Their noodles were thick too.  Sometimes I have low expectations with the noodles turning out to look like the packaged type because I don't want to get my hopes high, but this was not the case.  It was definitely real ramen.  Wish I could try more stuff, but this place is out of the way for me.  Oh, it really helps that I got the yelp deal as well.  I got the croquette and it was good :) I'm a happy camper.
author: Sandra W.

description: I love Genki! It's my go to ramen spot. The servers are friendly, the food is suuuuper yummy, and they have an AWESOME late night happy hour. What's not to love? I always get the spicy chicken ramen and tako yaki!!! The tako yaki is mouthwatering here. Overall it's quality Japanese food at a good price. Yay!
author: Morgan M.

description:
I've been to this location of Genki Ramen several times, and I always get one of the ramen selections. They're delicious and have good sized portions, which is always nice to fill me up on a cold day.

If you check in with yelp, you can get a free side dish (there's two options, but I forget what they are. One is edamame). 

The atmosphere can be noisy if it's packed, but I think all the times I've been there it has been relatively quiet. There are TV's all around the sides so if you're in an awkward conversation you can tune people out and just watch whatever is on (just kidding). 

Honestly, they don't have anything novel when it comes to ramen selection, but it's still really good. I remember getting the garlic tenderous rib ramen a few times, and it's really delicious and filling without being too flavorful in any way. The meat probably isn't for everyone because it feels kind of like fat since they make it soft and tender. The meat itself can be a little over-flavored, depending on your taste buds. 

Price is okay, it's not cheap, but it's nothing out of the ordinary either. I would recommend trying this place if you're just down for some ramen and you're close by.
author: Tina C.

description:
Top Ramen place in the area! Yum! 

Not the noodle in a cup, this place actually serves real ramen in a bowl. If you arrive during lunch time you can grab the lunch ramen combo which consist of and ramen dish with a side of a appetizer. 

Samurai wings are alright though. Very tangy and maybe too tangy for me. 

I'll come back whenever I'm in the area.
author: MarkJay A.

description:
This is based on my first time here. A group of friends (5 to be exact a few of which came here once) came here for a dinner we ordered the Crispy Sushi and Chicken Wings for appetizer. The crispy sushi turned out to be an over priced elegantly placed deep fried spring roll. Chicken wings were meh... The appetizer selection was extremely limited and pretty pricey if you are not there for happy hour.

Happy hour is from 3PM to 6PM and from 10PM till close.


The Food:

So most of us ordered the Rib Ramen in which the majority of the rib was bone. The broth was not all that good. Some what flavorful but seemed not as hearty or thick as other places. There is NO option to customize the ramen. What I mean is that if you want them to "hold the green onions" the answer is NO. One of our friends asked and it just wasn't possible... not sure why. Obviously requesting the egg in the ramen to be half cooked would be too much for them. There is however, a good amount of ramen selection.... but I don't think they are authentic Japanese style ramen. (Prob. Thai, with all those curry broths.)


The Service:

It was a bit hard waving someone over to get the order, not sure why. They were not understaffed. They did clear off any finish plates quick though. I think the staff got a bit annoyed when we sat and chatted a bit after we go the bill.

Ok... here's the thing:
This place charges you tips and grat. into the total. (Don't places include the charge if your party is 6 or over ?) ... yes it's the full 18% or 20% whether you like it or not. 


Overall:

There are WAY better places in the city to get your ramen fix. I don't think I'll be back here anytime soon.
author: Felix L.

description:
This review is based only on ramen.

My BFF actually warned me before we walked in and said "...just so you know, it's nothing like Santa Ramen.." That said, i was skeptical and figured that this is another over-rated ramen house. And to my surprise, I left this place quite satisfied! 

We had the following for lunch:
-Chasu Ramen with tonkatsu base, bamboo shoots and half boiled egg.
-Chicken Karaage with tonkatsu base, corn and wakame
-two sides of Gyoza (2 pieces each) for $1 extra per person.
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ml0zISgWDnt1hDWorSMNiw?select=sTbX6Frrz5DtE8wZ8YPPLg
Bill: $19.70

Their ramen has potential to be great but it lacked elasticity (that chewy, bounciness that i love in ramen noodles). Don't get me wrong, it is decent and better than most ramen joints that i've been to. The tonkatsu soup base was tasty, but lacked depth.

I'd come back again only if i'm in the area.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Not bad, until you think about how you can prepare yourself a similar bowl of ramen at home for 1/3rd the price.
author: John B.

description:
Was here on a Sunday around 2pm. No wait, but most tables were occupied. 

The menu has a ton of different kinds of ramen, which is quite different from most ramen places. Actually, the menu has all sorts of different things... I think it even has yakitori's 

I checked in using the Yelp app, and we got free chicken karaage :) it was pretty good (though I was starving...) got the Garlic Tenderous Rib ramen + corn. The ribs were tasty. Egg was hard boiled (boo). the sliced roasted garlic was soggy by the time I got the bowl (boo again). the ramen/spinach/soup/corn were not special. Portion was decent.
author: Diana C.

description: Was craving for ramen after getting off late from work, and the great part was they actually open late. The servicer was not very attentive, and knowledgable about their dishes. I've ordered their seafood ramen, lamb chops and seafood yakisoba but they were both very sweet. Not a very big fan of sweet dishes, but their lamb chops was really good with their house sauce!
author: Pam Ela Y.

description:
My signif is a big fan of ramen, and this place is open pretty late so we ate here.

The ramen is good, but nothing out of the ordinary when it comes to ramen.  It was everything you would expect out of a ramen place.  Which is nice when you are craving ramen at any time of the day.  The sides are relatively small when you order with the lunch combo.  The service isn't really up to par either, and they get extremely busy at night because of their late hours.  However, the wait isn't usually that bad.

When we came here last, they overcharged his card and we didn't find out until he got his statement.  Luckily Chase allowed him to verify it and he got to take off the extra charge himself.

I am interested in trying their different soju cocktails though.  Those are a little price-y, but maybe one day.

Overall, if you're looking for a good ole ramen place, this is good.  But if you want something to blow you out of the water, probably not here.
author: My An V.

description:
Addicted to their ramen, specifically the curry veggie ramen. Oh my goodness it is fantatsic! I wish I knew how to make the broth myself... Look forward to trying much more on the menu! 
Aside from the amazing food I also love the atmosphere of the restaurant. It's laid back, anonymous, dark, warm, loud, the bathroom is gorgeous.... It's basically what I want my opium den to be like but in this case my opiate is the veggie curry ramen om nom!
author: Libra J.

description: Hate to knock a place for being standard, but just kind of underwhelmed by the food and off put by the price. For a place with ramen in the name, their version was not distinct or a very good iteration.
author: E. W.

description:
Best tip: Wait until 10 pm for second HH if you want the best deal.  Either way, I ordered the Chicken Karaage (which isn't on HH).  We arrived at 9:40 pm so others waited it out for $3 Chicken Karaage, which is a regular sized portion!  The broth is heavy, which I definitely like.  The noodles are nice and soft and sprinkled with corn.  Alternate or combine with the chicken karagee on the side and you have the perfect comfort food!  $3 Pineapple drink was sweet and delicious.  

The service is great.  The waitresses have positive attitudes and are completely understanding of the clientele AKA we who want to save a few bucks so will clock watch LOL.  There are big screen tv's, a bar, and several tables, which makes for a good place to chill esp if you find a parking spot around the neighborhood.
author: Steph W.

description: Pretty good ramen for the price (around $10/dish). Not the best I've ever had, nor the worse. Serviceable. And quick service. Recommended.
author: Garett N.

description:
Is this place a chain?  The decor had us worried that it was... haha

Genki was the second ramen house we've been able to try in San Fransisco.  This time around we were pleasantly surprised with what we got.  Genki offers a large selection of Ramens and other dishes. Judging from their most popular chashu ramen we would say it's a decent 3.5 star Ramen house.

The broth had good flavor but was a little on the lite side.  
The noodles were slightly overdone. (it said on the menu that noodles are served medium but they were a little on the softer side)  
The broiled pork meat was better then average and had a lot of good pork flavor.

A major plus was the price of the lunch combo.  For two dollars cheaper you get the same amount of Ramen given in a regular order with the addition of fried rice, gyoza, or fried chicken.  We wouldn't recommend the fried rice.  It's not that it was bad but it's wasn't what we were expecting.  It kind of had the yakisoba seasoned taste which is something we don't really prefer.  The chicken was very crispy and was good with the sauce.  The smoothies were refreshing and at the end of the meal they gave Hi-chew with our receipt!!  We love Hi-chew and it tastes even better when it's free! :)
author: Trang H.

description: They put a lot of meat in their ramen. The portions are decent and the broth is good. It's not amazing, but I would come again if I was in the area.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Horrible wait staff.

We called for a reservation and they said we're on the reservation list. Was lied to and when we got there we found out they don't take reservations and had us sign in to the wait list.

We had a party of five, don't be surprised when they tack on the tip on their bill. They've done this to a party of three as well.

The food though was good but it's something you can find somewhere else who doesn't lie to you have give your poor service.
author: Harry T.

description:
Though it was an option in high school, I chose not to take Japanese as a language (en lugar, estudié Español). Still, "Ogenki desu ka? Hai, genki desu!" is one of the few exchanges I learned somewhere along the way. Are you fine? Yes, I am fine!

On its own, "genki" means health, happiness, and in good spirits. Genki is a state of being. Unsurprisingly, genki also pops up in a lot of restaurants (since who doesn't like to eat?)--ie, Genki Crepes on Clement, Genki Sushi in Hawaii, and of course, Genki Ramen. For me, ramen indeed is one of those things in life that simply does make me quite, quite genki.

At Genki Ramen, the ramen's ok. Not the best, but still capable of channeling genki.

Plus points for a lot of choices, from standard char siu to spicy mabo tofu. I tried the beef stew ramen recently (which is more like "stewed beef") and the fatty meat was packed with flavor. My problem with Genki's ramen is that it's kind of boring. The broth is pretty good, but they don't really garnish it with much. Though I'm pretty sure the ramen all falls under 10 bucks, I don't think the prices quite match up to what you get (or, what you don't)--I'd love it to see them a wee bit cheaper (of course, I'm the biggest cheapskate ever so I'm not sure if this is helpful).

In addition to ramen, they have yakisoba (fried noodles) and okonomiyaki (eggy floury pancake full of yummy things). For a good deal and something different, go for the seafood okonomiyaki topped with ramen noodles and bonito flakes--*nom nom nom*.

My other slight beef with Genki is that the service tends to be really slow. But I'm pretty sure it's because it's one of those places where Asian kids come and chill out foreverrrrrrrr and never leave (I think the plasma tv screens and the trendy interior have something to to do with it). So even though I tend to be a faster-paced Asian, I guess I can forgive this factor.
author: Kate V.

description:
Yeah I like ramen places.  And I live in this neighborhood.  And I like not walking over to Japantown all the time.  Been here twice now and tried 4 things (thanks to my girlfriend's tiny stomach) and I can't think of a single bad thing to say about it. 

Everything tasted great, and the other thing I really appreciated was a pretty substantial difference from one bowl to the next, instead of the usual change one minor variable, change name, and you have a new item.  Varied levels of spicyness, varied soup thickness, good flavor combinations.  Oh yeah and the atmosphere is pretty nice, decent drink options, and the price is right.
author: John S.

description:
This place reminds me of an "izakaya", more than a ramen house; since they offer so many different things other than ramen. I got the Chasu Tonkotsu Ramen along with Chicken Karaage, Takoyaki, Gyoza and their Tonkatsu Curry. Their food is good and the ramen was really delicious - especially their broth. 

Parking was hard to find; as there is only street parking. We parked about three blocks away. They do delivery, but I'm skeptical about having ramen delivered.  

I'm stopping by again, the next time I'm in the area!
author: Rei O.

description:
By far the best ramen west of Masonic Ave.  I have been here plenty of times and it is never a disappointment.  I'm no vegetarian, but there are times when all I want in a dish is everything but meat. 

I typically go with the mushroom ramen.  There are four different types of mushroom, the soup is savory and delicious and the noodles are just perfect! Last night I went with some friends after a long day of festivities and going with the spirit of trying new things, I decided to try a different dish! I got the veggie noodle plate and never looked back.  The noodles had so much flavor to them that I just about ate the whole thing, but I was struggling to finish because I was already so full from all the taste! Everyone else in the group stuck with the soup ramen, which was perfect for cold weather we were experiencing.  

The prices here are average, the service is friendly, the atmosphere is lively and fun no matter what time of day, they have TV's if you want to watch some sports and the food is beyond great.  The real kicker.. they are open very late, so you can get a good ramen in before the night is through.
author: Alexa V.

description:
I actually think it's hard to compare ramen places when the selections offered are different from place to place. In the end it's always based largely on my personal preference for the soup base, then comes the less important stuff like the actual texture of the ramen, the ingredients and the price of all the extras I want to add into it. My fave soup base is easily spicy garlic miso or tonkatsu... so when you don't offer that, you're out of the running for 5 stars in my book.

I went with the curry tonkatsu ramen based on yelp reviews while my sister got the chasu ramen - no extras. Got the free side dish of chicken karaage. The large piece of tonkatsu was super crispy and hot... pretty damn good! Noodles were soft and chewy to my liking. I thought the soup base was really good at first, but it must've been the curry flavor mixed in with the red ginger that got to me towards the end. I felt sick after eating it and I didn't even have that much ramen in my bowl.

After tasting my soup, I could barely taste the soup flavor in my sister's bowl. She said it was good, but she does favor the milkier soup bases a la Daikokuya over, for example, Ramen Dojo's. Don't be fooled though, it was a lot less flavorful than Daikokuya's tonkatsu base. Her chasu was the kind I like - part fat, part moist meat.

The chicken karaage reminded us of Popeye's chicken strips... same batter except it was dark instead of white meat. It arrived with the sauce drizzled on top but it wasn't enough! Nothing special. If it wasn't free, I wouldn't have ordered it. 

Eh. If I were in the area and was really craving ramen, maybe I'd come back and try the garlic tenderous rib one. But I'd probably drive to cute, little Saiwaii Ramen on Irving and 23rd/24th for their spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen instead!
author: Liana L.

description:
I have been dying to go to this place and finally got an opportunity to go this summer! Genki crepes is too delicious, so I figured their ramen place would be the same.
The ramen was okay. I think everything was just too salty! They had a lot of variety of ramens and if you paid an extra dollar you could get a bowl of fried rice! What a deal right? I liked it but I didn't consider it to be amazing or anything. I guess I would come back here if it was night time and I had a craving because they are open late!
author: Katrina T.

description:
I just had a delivered Beef Stew Ramen.

Although the broth was tasty, more than half of the meat was GRISTLE!

The gristle looked like and had the texture of a large foot callus.

Bleech!!!  Too bad I can't send it back.

Warning to restaurants:  Do not deliver your gristle to someone who has a macro lens.  Check my profile for the pics.
author: Zak W.

description:
My second time here. I inhaled my ramen soup in less than 5 minutes. Oh  yes I did! It's ramen soup with all the goodies - sliced pork, boiled egg, some veggies, and a spicy tasty broth. It wasn't soggy - as some of the reviews I read. It's comfort food that serves its purpose - makes me feel all warm, fuzzy, full, and happy. We also had the fried tofu which was more like agedashi tofu. I was expecting chinese fried style. The gyoza was also pretty good. 

Food - Tasty A -
Service - Attentive - A
Ambience - Typical Asian Style Cafe. They have TV screens so with sports - A -
author: Jen R.

description:
Ramen is still good, but service has deteriorated considerably (-1.5 stars).

Their teriyaki dishes are just average and portions are small (-0.5 stars).  I initially ordered the donburi, but then started to feel very uneasy when the server kept on reiterating that it doesn't come with soup or salad. She didn't say that it was extra to order, just that it doesn't come with it, probably about 5 times.  I asked her what I should do then, and she recommended getting the teriyaki rice dish instead.  Did that come with soup and salad?  Nope.  So why did she recommend the teriyaki dish?  I don't know, it's a mystery.
author: Daniel L.

description:
So this is a a place i'd recommend to people! It's not as good of a ramen as Ippuddo New York, but it's a restaurant I always crave when I'm in San Francisco! :D 

I love the noodles at Genki Ramen, but it really sucks that they don't have any pork belly dishes. The other thing is that I wish the broth was a bit better. The chasu ramen is definitely one I'd recommend. The pork isn't as tender as pork belly but it's definitely decent.

PROs: good atmosphere, awesome noodles, reasonable price

CONs: no pork belly
author: Funglin W.

description: tonkontsu base is made from a paste...that's why it doesn't have the rich taste of the pork bone. Seems, they added oil to the broth to give it a rich illusion. the ramen noodles are low quality--after 3 minutes, ramen absorbs broth quickly and becomes package/"top ramen" like. This place is like a fastfood ramen joint because of the instant noodle quality. downfall is the pricing for such low quality.
author: mary v.

description:
DELICIOUS!!! I always come here for their Green Tea Smoothie and Their Okonomiaki with Ramen are superb!!!!!! I love their Curry Ramen! SO delicious and great for friends who want to hang out and drink Sake on a friday night!!!! 

Everytime I come here I always enjoy the restaurants ambiance and food!!!!
I would recommend it to anyone !
author: Sophia W.

description: Go to spot for curry!!!!!Food is flavorful!!! Spices are married we'll together!!! Fried chicken is fried to perfection and chicken is moist and juicy. Fried rice is yummy I could eat it by itself. Ramen noodles are perfect. Katsu chicken tastes good in a soup with lots of curry on top! I highly recommend Genki Ramen to everyone to try once cause after that you'll be hooked. Thank you to the cooks at Genki Ramen your expertise is Def recognized through the food you put out.
author: Krystle K.

description:
This is the joint right here! Hella selections of ramen! Their Tonkatsu is on hit, and they have awesome appetizers. They are very generous with all the extra additives such as mushrooms, or veggies. 

There's a tv, they have a saki bar, and it's open late!

Downside is parking sucks ass...

If you are a ramen lover, bookmark this!
author: Lei L.

description: Pretty decent ramen and lots of different options. I love the butter and corn and the garlic pork - fattening but solo good on a cold and foggy night.
author: Lisette P.

description:
Food/Drinks
Nori Ramen- OK
Chasu ramen- Good
Gyoza- Very Good
Chicken Karaage- Very Good
So cool (yogurt soju)- Yum, but can never go wrong with this!


Service- A+
Friendly, attentive staff
author: Goldie L.

description:
My parents love their ramen. I mostly like the pork fried rice and ox tongue skewer. I was never really a favorite of any pork ramen. 

Today, I tried the kimchi ramen and I really liked it. I've always liked kimchi so it really changed my mind about the place. The noodles are firm, which is not something I like, but I'll usually just wait and let the noodles get softer from the hot soup. 

I really recommend the skewers. My parents really like the pork neck skewer. It's only one skewer for a couple of bucks, which is a little expensive for me. Service is pretty nice. The girls were really nice and polite. 

They even give you some candy in the end! Overall, it's a decent place to get ramen, but it gets four stars because the parents love it so much.
author: Jasmine W.

description:
Went here for lunch on a dreary San Francisco Saturday. We were seated quickly, but it took a long time for someone to come take our orders and give us water. 

When our ramen came out (chicken curry katsu and chashu) it was a good portion for lunch and the price. Noodles could have been cooked a little less, but in my chashu ramen there was a good amount of meat, mushrooms and green onions. One downfall was that I thought there wasn't quite enough broth for the amount of noodles.

I wish the service was a little faster, but overall, it was a good way to warm up in the always cold city.

Bonus: check-in on Yelp and get a free tofu or croquette appetizer!
author: Annaliese D.

description: I love Genki Ramen! Every time you check in on Yelp! you get a free appetizer. I always get their garlic rib ramen in miso broth and the beef Okonomiyaki. Both are really good! Genki is just a great local spot for hot ramen on those frequent Inner Richmond fog nights. It's 100% San Francisco comfort food at it's tastiest.
author: Tashina G.

description:
Genki Ramen is one of my favorite places to eat.  The place is clean, a nice ambiance, and is open late when you must have japanese food that isn't sushi.

I usually have the Sumo okonomiyaki which is a noodle pancake topped with seaweed, japanese mayo, bacon, cheddar cheese, and fish flakes.  I usually get this when I'm in my fat kid state of mind.

The beef & enoki roll is meaty without being too salty and the mushrooms make it seem healthier and guilt free, but I'm sure it's not cause it tastes too good.

Finally, the Salmon fried rice is incredibly tasty.  It's not over cooked and there is a surprisingly large amount of salmon in the rice.

If you want late night eats that's a little different, go here.
author: Randy M.

description:
I stumbled upon this place while walking with a friend from Laurel Village down Geary.  We were just looking for a random place to eat close to 3pm on a Sunday.  We were just talking about how we both want to go to San Mateo to eat ramen and that we can never get in because we go when the restaurants are closed for vacation or we arrive during the off-peak hours when they happen to be closed.  So it was rare to see a ramen place open between 2 and 5pm.

Luckily, 3pm is when Happy Hour starts here and there was hardly a crowd at all inside so we were seated right away.  In addition, the lunch menu is good 7 days a week until 5pm.  They have a good selection of food on their menu.  You can get the lunch special ramen for about $7.95  and add a side dish for just $1 more.  That would be 2 gyozas or 2-3 pieces of chicken karage.  We asked how big the happy hour size was for the same dishes, she said it was a little bigger so we opted for happy hour portions.  The two of us ordered way too much food.  They gave us 6 gyoza, and a whole plate of karage for just $3 a dish.  Not bad for the size.  We also ordered the croquettes- 2 McDonald's hash brown sized croquettes on a plate.
 
I ordered the chasu ramen that comes with the basic tonkatsu broth and my friend ordered the kimchi ramen.  We both liked our ramen.  There was a good amount of chasu that was soft enough that it fell apart easily but was not overcooked.  It comes with an egg and a ton of green onions and bamboo.  I would have to say it was very flavorful.  Not too salty and not overcooked.  I probably finished all the broth.  I was pretty impressed considering we had no expections for this place.

We ended up with quite a big of leftovers since the chicken karage appetizer was a good size.  Though sometimes my stomach is not  fully satisfied after eating ramen, I didn't feel jipped by portion sizes here at all.  I was so full that I couldn't even eat anything else for the rest of the night.  I will definitely return.  In fact, I almost returned the next day but decided to wait just a little bit.  Don't forget to check in or print their online coupons for a free appetizer!
author: Stacey C.

description:
I think Genki Ramen set the standard for me for Ramen. I had visited this place with my family and friends and we all ordered different items off the menu including the sake(served hot). The broth is out of this world. Ramen cooked perfectly. There was nothing to complain about on the service as it was friendly and fast. 
The food is of quality and there is time and love in making this food that you can taste. I would come back for the food. Delish!
author: Chau L.

description:
Add me to the many many fans of genki ramen.

It's good because

+everything is under 10 dollars

+the robatayaki is all reasonably prices with many under 3 dollars

+the ramen is always good and served quick and hot

+japanese sodas like Ramune

+clean modern setting without being pretentious or douchey

The not as good things
-there was piece of chicken in the French spouse's vegetarian yakisoba, which was tasty enough that the French spouse just put it aside and eat the rest of the dish

-they gave us the check without asking if we wanted to order dessert

-all the ramen have a beef broth base unless you specifically as for a vegetarian one even if all the additional ingredients are vegetarian

Still everything was good and we will go back there for sure, just maybe make real sure that the dishes are in fact vegetarian.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
Janky Ramen is more like it! 

Yes, they're open late. Yes, they have bright shiny t.vs which always show the Giants' games. Yes, the prices aren't bad. But... you will be sicker than a dog if you dare to eat here!

Edamame was small and needed salt desperately. Both ramens had a strange musky odor and both were the same color, with the same cloudy, salty broth. Sake was microscopic. 

Several moments after leaving, I felt green around the gills, and had to make a mad dash into a nearby bar restaurant to have a reversal of ramen fortune. My date was ill for two hours. 

Worst part was a strange plate of pickeled veggies that were served before the meal. Smelt and tasted like my feet after a day on the town without socks.
author: Zachary S.

description:
If you're craving super oily, unhealthy, and bite sized dishes then, come here. Otherwise, look somewhere else for more flavorful, fulfilled and healthy food.

I was here to celebrate Pride with my friends and cousin and we all decided to come here (but, it was cuz and my first time here) and I was super disappointed. Yes, this place serves tapas style, but, the portions were small; which, I know is ironic. Let me explain. So, I ordered the asparagus bacon wrapped dish and it showed up with literally 3 small bite sizes (which I'm being generous about the description) and I also ordered the scallops which were also on the super small size. I also ordered a side of brown rice, which was the biggest portion of food that I was served that night!

To make matters worst, my drink (which was supposed to be an adult beverage) tasted of NO alcohol. And, the pineapple juice they used left a bad aftertaste of the metal can the juice once lived in. Are you kidding me??? I will NEVER come back to this place, despite my friend's approval of this restaurant. There are definitely way better tapas places in the City than this place. You'll be gravely disappointed. 

Save yourself some time and money and run away from this place!

Another thing, parking sucks out in the Richmond District anyway, so, definitely avoid this restaurant.
author: Doc V.

description: Oh man, I missed out on the free edamame or fried tofu. Oh well. Genki Ramen is what you'd typically expect at any ramen place. Not terribly expensive and not terribly overpriced. There is a wide variety of items though. I ended up getting the chicken karaage ramen and my friend got chicken katsu. The chicken karaage apparently comes separately with your ramen so you get an entree and an appetizer all in one. The karaage had a weird chalky taste to it. Overall, this place is good if you're looking for a quick bite to satisfy your hunger.
author: Amy J.

description: It was OK, nothing special though.  Broth was decent but was not impressed with noodles.  We also got the Kid's menu for my daughter with Tonkatsu and it was mostly breading with very little dried up meat.
author: Edward L.

description: Gosh, this place is good. Their service is good. Their noodle just as amazing! Definitely  you need a try on it.
author: Jerry S.

description:
I had the chashu ramen, and it was okay. The noodle tasted very packaged--like those from the supermarket. The broth is flavorful, but left me dying of thirst after. The pork was good, soft and tender. 

I really like that you can just add $1 during lunch for a side (gyoza, chicken kaarage or pork fried rice). 

The restaurant is pretty clean and modern vibe. The service was okay.
author: Mandy C.

description:
I'm not a ramen expert, but I really enjoyed Genki and would eat there again if I was in the neighborhood. The menu is huge, which makes it convenient to eat there in a group since there's something for everyone.

I had a bowl of the chicken karaage ramen. The chicken came on its own plate on the side, which I appreciated because that meant you could keep the chicken very crispy. The chicken was really nicely deep fried so that it was crunchy without seeming greasy. The one negative was that the pieces were sort of pink inside, which I don't think was a mistake but turned me off a little bit. Additionally, I think I ordered the ramen as a combo or something, so it also came with a generous side bowl of chashu/pork fried rice. OMG. That was fantastic; oily, salty, delicious. 

The ambiance isn't super great, but it's clean and bright and spacious.
author: Ada T.

description:
Football Thursday!  That is available only on cable!  And Cable costs the life of your three unborn children.  What is a girl to do when she has no cable, it's getting cold out there, and Tebow is playing?  She goes down to Genki Ramen where every single TV screen is playing the game. 

Marina and I sat on the same side of the table, facing the tv.  Tebow is important.  I previously had never seen him without his gear on.  He looks quite impressive from the back.  Slurp.  Yum.  I'm talking about the ramen, of course.

We decided to share a bowl of ramen because the menu had too much stuff to try.  Since my initial encounter with spicy miso tofu kimchi ramen was meh, I recommended the mushroom ramen.  It turned out to be delicious with succulent slices of trumpet mushrooms, button mushrooms, oyster mushrooms and one symbolic shiitake mushroom.  The broth was greatly improved from last time.  It was flavorful and not too salty.  A liberal sprinkling of red pepper powder and a drizzle of oil chili oil brightened my eyes and turned on the nose faucet.  

The sesame wings were bleh.  Overly sweet and glazed.  Nothing special.  I was really craving some dry chicken wings.  Salt and pepper with some slices of jalapeno.  Not glazed, tossed, drowned, sugar-coated.  And there were only 4 wings.  For $6.  I think it was not worth it.  I need to start looking for those places that have happy hour wings for $0.50.  WHERE ARE MY PEOPLE?  The WING PEOPLE?
