misstep after misstep. not to mention that the DVD they were playing of j-pop videos looped after about half an hour so we saw it a few times. 

all in all, it looks like it's going to be really nice, but the food is a total mess. i mean, the place is called "genki ramen" and the ramen isn't good. if you can't get the name of the food in your restaurant's name correct, well... there's not that much hope, is there?
author: christian n.

description:
Creative, hearty, great Ramen!!!!

I like exploring Ramen restaurants since it's one of my favorites and I brought my friend there two days ago.  Before he ate, he said, 'oh there's great ramen restaurant in Los Angeles, I doubted this quality would even be close."  And sure enough, after he ate the Chasu Ramen, he said, "mmmm, this is pretty damn good!"

The Ramen is 'al-dente', soup tasted good but not too heavily salty (which a lot of the other Ramen restaurants have), good value (considering they are on the main busy Geary Blvd), and surprisingly good service!!! (My table's tea cups were never empty and the waitresses were courteous)

I had the seafood ramen (shrimps, scallops, mussel, etc), my friend had the veggies ramen (savory veggies), and of course the chasu ramen was really good!

I look forward to going there again and try the amazing selection of Sochu cocktails and sakes (pretty good selection, from ginjo to dai-ginjo) and did I say DRAFT Sapporo and Kirin?

Cheers!!!!
author: Jordan L.

description:
This place offers  above than average food overall and it definitely deserved at least 4 stars. I gave them an extra star because of the wide selection of dishes, from Ramen to BBQ dishes and more. There are certain dishes which are definitely ranked pretty high on my chart.

Yeah, they might not be THE best Ramen place in the bay area, but definitely one of the best!

Definitely a must-try place in the city if you are looking for Jap. food.
author: Oyster K.

description: the ramen is super yums!! the broth super tasty with good portions of noodles. not too much, not too little. the kimchi ramen totally hit the spot. the gyozas were super tasty as well. service was good.
author: Linda N.

description:
4 stars for the food, 3 stars for the service...Besides the service, the food was WAAAAAY YUMMY!! I had the SPICY MABO TOFU, which was pretty good...a little spicier than japantown ramen but still good. Hubby had the curry pork chop ramen, dad had Chashu ramen and shirley had Unagi Don. All of it was pretty yummy they said...ONLY THING...we ordered the  CHICKEN WING appetizer...honey spicy something and OMG DID THAT TAKE FOREVER...the appetizer came out way after our ramen came out...Sorta yummy but too spicy and sour. 
     
      Hubby and I always wanted to try this place. He LOVES ramen...but from the reviews I read on Yelp, ie, slow service, noisy atmosphere...we were hesitant...There was no other ramen place close to us, so we decided to give Genki Ramen a try. The restaurant was bigger than I thought. The prices were reasonable...AND their lunch menu was approx $1-1.50 cheaper than the regular price menu and it was for the SAME size portion of ramen. So, THAT was a plus. The noise level wasnt too bad, but we went on a sunday afternoon and it was rainy that day...I could tell that if it was a Friday night, it could be VERY loud and it wouldnt be pleasant. The service was so so...there were only 2 waitresses and 1 bus boy and 2 cooks. Our waitress spoke english very well, the other one not so well. Their attentiveness was so so, but being that they were the only 2 taking care of the restaurant, it was still an effort to flag them down to the table...
     ALL IN ALL i'd go there again, just NOT on a Friday night...and NOT when im in a rush to go somewhere.
author: LM J.

description: I enjoyed the atmosphere here! The food was fairly good, but it did not wow me, especially for the price. The chicken kaarage and katsu ramen are my favorite. They're the reason why I will probably come back soon.
author: Haven L.

description: I love how this place is very modern japanese looking. I love the flat screen LCDs they have, and the tables are quite sleek. The broth of the ramen, tastes pretty good, but not as great as Santa Ramen is San Mateo. The menu has a wide variety of appetizers, robatiyaki, main courses, such as the okonomiyakis, fried rice... etc... And they have a wide selection of Sake and other Alcoholic Drinks as well.
author: Brian P.

description: The food isn't bad, but nothing to write home about. It's so faux Japanese and the prices are steep. I had the curry tonkatsu ramen and the tonkatsu was less than stellar (super tough.) Service is mediocre - waiters aren't that friendly; not rude, just unattentive. The only redeeming quality is the TV's :)
author: Mel L.

description: Thus starts my love affair with ramen... mmmhhh
author: Neil T.

description:
good ramen is very hard to find in san francisco.  if you have ever been to japan and tried the ramen at jangara you know how real ramen is supposed to be.  now, jangara being the high standard, most ramen in the usa is no comparison, even in the asian rich communities in our bay area.  i was pretty stoked to see a new ramen shop open in my neighborhood with the appearance of genki ramen.  with the tasty crepes at the original genki crepes and mini mart location on clement street, i went to genki ramen with a good feeling.

pleasant decor and seating was easy.  the greeter was friendly.  the menu looked good with alot of choices and japanese style "bar food"  dishes.  

after mulling over the menu, things started to turn, our server was nice but coughed towards us without covering her mouth or turning away...hmm...not so good.

after ordering our various dishes we hoped that our server wasn't going to cough on our food when bringing them to our table.  it took longer than expected to receive our food, but fortunately it was brought to our table by someone other than coughing-server.  food was hot and pretty tasty.  the smaller bar food style "tapas" were fun "finger foods" and prepared well.  the ramen was hot and portions looked good.  overall the ramen was good but nothing really exceptional.  it was certainly better than many ramen dishes in j-town.

it took a long time to try and flag down anyone to give us our check.  it wasn't particularly busy, but the staff were engaged in chats behind the counter and sending text msgs on their cell phones.

genki ramen is convenient for me to get to on nights i want a hot bowl of decent ramen.  the bar food dishes satisfy my hankering for tasty tidbits.

i've been here at least a half of dozen times, the food is always decent but not stellar.  fortunately, coughing-server has not been seen by me sincee my first time there.  the food is usually prepared pretty well but can vary in "quality" or at least in content, for instance the chicken karaage on some nights can actually contain chicken meat, other nights its mostly skin, but heck, if you want something fried hard, it does reach that objective.

i would consider genki ramen a decent place for japanese style fast or bar food.  i like the varied selection and its a convenient location for anyone in the inner richmond neighborhood.  i really want to love this place, but i usually enter and leave with my expectations set at a mid-low level, and with that mindset genki does the job.

service and staff have been consistently friendly yet, unattentive and slow.  food, once ordered is usually brought to your table quickly and hot.

the best ramen in the bay area still goes to santouka in san jose by far.
author: Patrick M.

description:
food: 3 star
waitress: 2 star
high def tv: 5 star
mohito: 4 star

decent food for the area. lots of msg in the broth.
author: Bobby B.

description: Not Bad, I'd rather go to Japantown to get my Ramen, but if your in the area this is a ok place.
author: David L.

description: the garlic tender rib ramen was absolutely divine! the broth was so rich and thick. the ramen isn't the crappy type from other restaurants. this one had substance and cooked to perfection. the rib was fatty and tender, permeating and flavoring the broth.  definitely going to come back. also excellent service, very fast.
author: Tori E.

description:
It was a busy night, but the waitress was able to spread herself efficiently. We got just right amount of attention. She earned her 22% tip. The happy hour food choices were all fried, are they trying to fatten people up? So I end up just sharing a big bowl of curry noodle soup. Great hot warm green barley tea. 

Quick fast Service 4 stars
Free green strong tea 5 stars
Curry Ramen Noodle soup 3 stars
Happy hour food choices 1 star
author: A Z.

description: I really love going to restaurants where you can order a plethora of menu items to try, and not feel guilty about the bill when it comes. The food here is pretty darn good for the price you pay. We ordered an abundance of dishes; Fried Tofu, Grilled Oysters, Seafood Okonomiyaki, Chashu Chahan, Shisamo, Pumpkin and Sweet Potato Tempura, Short Ribs, Grilled eggplant and grilled mushrooms. The service was really good and the atmosphere was very enjoyable especially with all the Flat panel TVs playing the Warriors game.
author: Marco M.

description:
I've been coming here periodically for a while and comparing it to the Yelp ratings - I'm surprised this doesn't rate much higher. 

I find this the most authentic ramen I've found in SF - that's comparing to some of the places I visited in Tokyo (including the extreme long-line places). 

Maybe it's a problem with consistency (different chefs at different times of day?) - it's always been excellent the times I go. I usually go at night or on weekends/Friday.

As a comp, I've tried Katana-Ya near Union Square, which is usually packed, and now gets 4 stars on Yelp - I'd definitely rate Genki Ramen (all times) above Katana-Ya's best.  

You'll also find things that you wouldn't find elsewhere - I love the Samurai wings!
author: Ed L.

description: if you want to be served by pushy, rude individuals then go here. I decided to treat myself to a late dinner with a friend after a very successful work day.  according to yelp they were open until 1am, but just to verify we called in.  we had went there with 45 minutes left until 1am... I asked the if it was too late for us to be seated since I understood the desire to leave as early as possible on a Saturday night.. the server said "no" seated us and asked us if we wanted to order anything. I requested some time to review the menu. he went to his co-worker and did not realize that I understood and could hear clearly what they were saying. he returned shortly after and said "can you order NOW?"  I requested a couple more minutes. As soon as he returned we ordered our food and made special requests...  no pork (for health reasons) I politely asked him to please make sure there was NO PORK.  he and his co-worker were in such a rush to get out that they were just tossing plates and bowls down on the table as opposed to gently placing (which you think they would because of the hot soup and hot tea we ordered, btw can you say.... "LAAAWWWSUUIIIITTTTT" ) after making myself a little bowl of ramen I began to eat as quickly as possible thinking that I would hurry and get out of here since they didn't want me here and I didn't want to be in here with such a rude staff... I was just too hungry to think of another place, As I'm eating, I bite into a piece of pork. now if you don't know what gout is... you would want to avoid anything that could trigger it again. I simply stopped eating and sat there the server came over and picked up my bowl without even asking... funny how he didn't even need to ask. kinda makes me wonder if he did it purposely to get us out..  basically, if there is anything I want you to take from this... A) don't work in the food industry if you don't want to be mindful of others' dietary needs. B) please do not work such late shifts if you do not want to be there, you pretty much ruin EVERY ONE ELSE'S night.  My experience here actually made me want to open a ramen house right next door and show them how their patrons should certainly be treated and appreciated as opposed to feeling ignored and insulted. it's funny how other ramen houses in downtown SF with all the crazies are more courteous.  Whoever runs that restaurant should really take in consideration this, if two individuals would rather deal with an area with no parking in a busy city with interesting individuals from now on... than to return to your restaurant and there are other reviews on yelp as well as those I have personally vented to saying the same thing... maybe it's time for a meeting or some new staff. just saying....
author: Steph S.

description: I love ramen, so when my sister introduced me to this restaurant, I was all for it! This restaurant is a cute little place on Geary St. with interesting decor; there are plasma TV's on the walls that play chinese or japanese music videos, they have a small bar, nice seating areas and an open window kitchen area. The only dish I order is the Yasai ramen. It is very tasty and filled with hearty vegetables. All the flavors combined create a wonderfully filling meal. The housemade ramen never gets too mushy and it tastes great in the pork broth. Although a bowl of ramen will probably run you about $7 - $11, it is well worth it.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
My roommates and I are seriously addicted to this place! Since they introduced it to me in November I have brought several friends here and they are crazy about it also. The service is not good haha.. you basically have to throw yourself at a server to get their attention but i have even grown to love this because i go so often that its so humorous.. for this i have to lower my rating to a 4 cause some people will find this a problem. I have tried so many things and loved them all except the gyoza which i recommend you skip.. the ramen or other options are worth saving your appetite for. You get HUGE servings and will love every bite, I had a hard time at first veering from my normal order (veggie ramen w/ spicy paste) cause it was so good but i am so glad i did because I enjoy so many of their dishes now (curry veggie ramen, tonkatsu ramen, the list goes on, everything is good).. the next thing i want to try is their pizza, anyone try it?? 

all in all i love this place and highly recommend it!!!
author: Barbara C.

description: I've been here several times with friends and with my ex. We both love the atmosphere and the food. Though sometimes the service can be somewhat spotty (only one or two waitstaff for the entirety of the restaurant). We always order the shrimp tempura ramen with corn and spicy miso and the chicken yakisoba. The ramen is perfect (nothing like the stovetop kind), and the yakisoba is a bit greasy but what do you expect from, "pan fried" noodles? Overall for the price he and I, and others who have gone, reccomend it for a nice cheap night out.
author: Kyle L.

description: their mabo tofu ramen was pretty good.  but that's about it.  i didn't like the other ramen flavs.
author: Kae B.

description: went here with some friends and I like the place. The ramen was good but a bit too salty. I like the atmosphere but they need to reupholster their seating...
author: meL Z.

description: The ramen here was unsatisfying and too expensive for what it was. Had the seafood ramen and everything tasted bland. They charge a lot b/cuz they've decked the place out with plasmas and a nice looking bar. Skip this one.
author: Joel L.

description:
I went here once and never went back. I guess it didn't reach my expectation especially the food. I thought the food is something that you can find inside your pantry and make it yourself. I suggest go the grocery store and buy pack of ramen noodle, veggie and meat then cook it your own. The skewer and tempura are the same thing...don't waste your money here.

So, I'm not coming back to this place. The place is nice though that's the only comment I can give.
author: JM M.

description: When I crave warm soupy goodness in my neighborhood, Genki Ramen is always my first choice. Last time I was here on a Wednesday night, the place filled up by the time we left - at around 9pm. Seemed like there were a lot of local regulars that night. My favorites are the Mapo Tofu (spicy ground pork and tofu) and the Yasai (veggie) ramen. They have a decent selection of Japanese tapa-like dishes and desserts as well. I love when they play J-Pop videos on their flat screen tv's -- can get a little distrcting at times, but it definitely adds to the experience.
author: Manisha M.

description:
Where does one go for fabulous ramen in the city?  Not to Genki Ramen, but if you're willing to settle for something to satisfy a ramen craving, then this will definitely do.  

They didn't have my favorite shoyu sauce (booo) but their pork soup base was not that bad.  Weird, as mentioned previously, that their appetizers (gyoza) came so far after the ramen that I was almost done and going to ask the waitress to cancel it if it hadn't been forgotten.  

They are understaffed and have rather unspectacular service.  Also, I didn't notice any Japanese people in here, that is a bad sign for authenticity.  WHERE DO THEY GO FOR RAMEN? TAKE ME WITH YOU.  But until then, Genki Ramen isn't a terrible substitute.  

Must continue the search.
author: Alison K.

description:
Been here several time to try out different kinds of food on the menues but never get a chance to write a review. Here I am.

I'd tried 
chashu ramen lunch special with the $1 gyoza- it was decent portion.
Curry beef ramen - not my kind and would not go for it again, the beef is kind of mix with the curry and they top that on the ramen,
Spicy yakisoba - it was good as there are some spice of kimshi in there and the sausage is the spicy kind.
Takoyaki - how could I not love this thing, especially getting it at the happy hour time.
Beef roll - This is too salty
Sumo okonomiyaki - the time I had this I think the bacon is terribly burnt so I tried another one the otherday.
Seafood okonomiyaki - it was great, I like it.
Chashu cold ramen -  I'm a fan, so in love with it.
Chicken and saba terriyaki rice - they are typical kind of terriyaki which I love.
Garlic tenderous rib ramen -  I recomment this even though there are bones but the meat is really tenderous
Maccha swirl drink -  you gotta love this, is so yummy gotta have it everytime I'm there.

My sister tried the unagi rice and she told me it was salty, how could a unagi rice be salty but she was right, I tried it and it was salty.
I pretty much like this place for the takoyaki, everything else is ok and most of them are salty.
The service was good. 
The decoration was cool especially now at the christmas month.
author: Alternate N.

description: The environment is pretty nice and very clean.  you can tell they are putting a lot of money to try to attract and please their customers.  I was actually feeling pretty good about it when I first entered it, but the food is totally different story...  I tried the Ramen and fried saki there, but none of them turned out to be tasty at all.  I guess I may still go there to have a drink or snack if I run out of choice for gathering place, but probably not for meal.  Sorry.
author: Bryan W.

description: We ordered take out from here through Grubhub.com. Awesome service by the way because you can order online. When I first saw okonomiyaki options on the menu, I was excited because I don't know of many places that offer this kind of variety ever since trying it for the first time in Japan. I ordered the seafood okonomiyaki. It tasted ok but i think they should have more cabbage and less batter. The garlic rib ramen is ok and definitely not something you will want to write home about. Too much bones and cartilage on the riblets. I think the shiitake skewer is a rip off because it was only 3 small mushrooms for $2.75. I mean seriously, I can get a pound of fresh shiitake at that price at the local asian market.
author: Yenly M.

description:
yes i like it here.
they are open when so many other places are closed. 
 i'm not talking about on the late night tip, although they are open till 1 am on weekend nights and DELIVER! until 10 pm.
geez, i guess i am a bit of an early bird special kinda person.
anywhoo, Q, which is on the other side of the block is closed between 3 and 530.  sushi bistro is the same.  many places in japantown are also that way as are japanese restaurants in general.
genki ramen is not only open during those times, that is when the happy hour magic happens.  I did not participate because i tend to just like what I like- big beer and big meal, not small beer and small meal over and over again.  
okonomiyaki is fine, korroke is good, veggie gyoza is yummy, some good interesting stuff.
author: yayoi s.

description:
Traditional Japanese dishes SUCK! But the mapo tofu ramen and kimchee ramen are edible. 

Why is the gyoza sauce sweet???
author: C K.

description: The ramen was above average and so is price. Overall the quality of the food is not bad. You dont have to come here on purpose, but if you pass by, give it a try.
author: Jolin L.

description: Really a 3.5 star, but while B*Star got the extra bump up to four, genki's food wasn't really at that level, so it has slid back a bit.  Watermelon freeze was refreshing.  Cheesy Jap-Pop music videos are fun to watch for a while, but while you wait for your server to finally bring the bill, they become a bit grating.  I think if I worked there, I would have to spear my ear with a chopstick.  Kim chi Ramen was good, but a little bland.  I was definitely hoping for more, considering how much I enjoy Genki Crepe.  I try it again, but I was a little disappointed.
author: Benjamin P.

description:
the chasu ramen was dee-licious!  we came here on a sunday at 2 pm and no one was in here, so we didn't have to wait for anything and the service was fine.  the portions were perfect!

the japanese music videos playing on the flat-screen tvs are a bit overwhelming and hyperactive, so i wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking to chill out or have decent conversation...
author: cindy c.

description: They've got a good selection of ramen ingredients, but I would still go to Hotei over this place. You can watch the crazy japanese music videos on TV for added entertainment
author: Jon S.

description: Delicious ramen - I've been here many times with my bf whenever I feel like having non-pho type Asian-style noodles and soup. My favorites are the kimchi ramen and the chashu ramen, while my bf prefers the curry tonkatsu ramen. The noodles are tender, but not overcooked, and the soup has a great multi-layered flavor (it also feels so nice on a cold winter day). I actually like the decorations, too, it feels kind of modern and young, especially with the flat screen TVs (but I do agree that it is sort of distracting when there's a tv everywhere you turn). The only thing I would think that is not so stellar about this place is the gyoza. It's nothing really special. If you buy your own dumplings and pan-fry them, they would be pretty much the same as these ones.
author: Ann L.

description: HORRIBLE service. My table and I waited a good half hour before our order was even taken, and another half hour to get our food. The Ramen was decent enough, I'll give 'em that I s'pose.
author: Jen O.

description: Trendy ramen place, food is good, portions OK. Cooks are Japanese, at least when I was there. Waitress were not Japanese but that's OK. Pretty authentic for being so far from Japan. They cook the Ramen like the way they do in Japan, but rinsing the noodle by swinging the collinder in the open floor so the extra broth splashes on the ground. I would say this place is for casual lunch time or normal meals. Kind of fancy for that.
author: Phillip K.

description: i've been sick this past week, and the bf was kind enough to bring home hot bowls of ramen from genki.  i was pleased enough with my ramen, but i think ramen taste much better when freshly served.  it hit the spot and warmed me up.  although the ramen was nice, i've had better ramen.
author: Sheri N.

description:
Every ramen I have tastes different. Is this the best in the Bay Area? No, it's not. But considering a few things, it's a very solid place to go for ramen.

1. It's fairly close by, and even if I don't want to be bothered going there...
2. Genki delivers! Free! and gives you a cute grocery bag from their genki crepes location
3. The ramen is pretty good. I don't go "ooooooooh" like I do with Santa Ramen, but I'm a big  fan of their curry and cha shu ramens

The decor is kind of silly for ramen, but they do have like 4 tv's facing you at any given time. In case you need to watch food being cooked on Food Network while you eat your food.
author: Karen J.

description: Beef stew ramen is really good... Both times I've been for a weekday lunch there was only one waitress, so it was hard when it was crowded to get her attention ... But she definitely worked hard and hustled
author: j w.

description: Consistency is what I will use to define this place. Quick and friendly service, Consistently Good Food and the wait for a table is not too bad usually. My staples are the Veggie Gyoza and the Ramen with Curry Veggie. I usually end up here on days that i feel particularly hungry, they serve huge portions. I don't care much for their house tea though. You could hate on me for giving this place 4 stars, but I'm from the wrong part of Asia, hence their Ramen taste's A-Ok to me. Oh they're open late too.
author: Tushar V.

description: i rate the food about  7, nothing too impressive for their prices.  Service was fine and decorations were nicely organized.  this visit is probably a one thing time, unless im starving on a saturday night.  if you want soupy noodles, i recommend citrus club on haight, way tastier and prices are a bargain!
author: Hana ..

description: I went here with some friends after the GLAY concert last night.  We went there right before closing, I felt bad for the wait staff and apologized for our lateness.  I ordered the Garlin Short Ribs Ramen, it sounded good. Meat was very flavorful, but just didn't fit in ramen.  Actually a lot of the ramen combinations seemed strange to me on the menu.  The noodles also were a little overcooked and short for my taste.  Overall I was not a fan of the ramen.  The place was clean and the atmosphere was nice, I like that they play J.pop over the speakers.  It was good to watch the Olympics on the nice TVs.  I also was impressed by the Large Kirin for $5, it was quite nice.  The Karage was pretty tasty too.  I would go again, I just wouldn't order the Ramen.  So 2 stars for a place with ramen in the title the Ramen is just not good.
author: Peter W.

description: i've been here a couple of times, the ramen is pretty decent, i had the chicken karaage curry ramen, the soup was flaorful but i only got like 2 small pieces of chicken which was kind of disappointing. but i would come back here the food wasnt too bad. my friends had the yakisoba and the unagi don and they both liked it too.
author: Stella J.

description: I was really skeptical about going to a restaurant where menu consisted mostly of ramen dishes but I was pleasantly surprised. I like ramen as much as any other college student. I ordered ramen with crispy chicken and was glad that when it arrived, the chicken and the ramen were on separate dishes. Pretty nice for a quick lunch.
author: Maggie L.

description: I like this place better then Ramen Club in Burlingame more because the decor is more trendy and service is much better. They also have more food and drink selection on their menu. As far as Ramen goes, I think they are about the same taste wise. Ramen tasted more fresh here though. If you had to come here, I would recommend getting the Cha Shu Ramen. Do not order any of their fried pancake dishes. It's awful.
author: HUNG L.

description:
authenticity isn't such a big issue for me as long as the food is tasty.  good service helps too and the waitresses here kept us waiting too long for everything.  

that said, i cannot believe there were so many people eating here.  

the ramen is average or even below.  no choices for a miso or shoyu broth.  no basic ramen bowl available... the closest was the chashu which was more meat than i'd like.  broth had lots of... garlic?  weird.  the noodles could be better too, was too limp and dense and could be a little springier.

the fried soft shell crab was fishy tasting.  ew.

my boy had a lukewarm dry ramen thing (which he was hoping was like a hiyashi chuka but our waitress didn't even know what that was.)  but nope, not it.  

the only thing that was really tasty was the beef kabob.  we might give this place one more chance, but i certainly would not get ramen here again.
author: Miss K.

description: I was craving for some ramen so decided to try out this place. When I walked in, I was taken back from the decor. It was a little bit too posh. :P I am used to ramen shacks that look like they are about to collapse. After all ramen is comfort food, not upscale dinning. I ordered some chashu ramen and fried tofu. The fried tofu was pretty good, but not crisp enough for my taste. The ramen broth was pretty good, the egg was perfect, and the pickled bamboo shoots delicious. However, the pork was not as fatty as I expected. ( I need my comfort food after all) The noodles were okay, for hand made noodes (or so they claim) it didn't live up to my expectations. Also, the price for the meal was more expensive than I cared for a simple meal... but maybe it is just the city in general? :)
author: Tsu C.

description: Lots of vegetarian options (just ask for the vegetarian broth)!  Our favorite was the curry veggie ramen. The mushroom ramen was pretty good, but the miso broth wasn't as flavorful as the broth with the curry. The mushrooms were fantastic though!
author: Rachael S.

description: decent ramen with a good variety of choices. it is in no way close to being as wondrous as Katana ya or Santa Ramen, but if i need a ramen fix while i'm at work, they offer delivery service, which is nice.
author: Regina C.

description: I've only tried the chashu ramen so far but I'm sold!  I was spoiled with tasty ramen in NYC and am glad to finally find a ramen spot in my hometown that can make good rich broth.
author: PM o.

description: 1st meal in sf from our 5 hr flight from hawaii. our pals took us and it was aite.  kinda felt rushed.  the chasu is yummy!
author: Rita L.

description:
The best Ramen I've ever had is probably at home, where my boyfriend cooks me spam and eggs with Japanese Ramen Noodles.
That's why I never even try step into one of these restaurants, it just doesn't seem right to serve Ramen noodles at a restaurant, and this place was nice too! The atmosphere is dim, and the utensils are all very clean and neat. Very modern decor. The food served quickly. 
The noodles were okay. I like my ramen just cooked, not soggy. I ordered the combo, so I got the pork fried rice. Which was soooo good. I definetely liked the pork fried rice more than the ramen itself. Service was average. 3 stars for the okay food, and the extra point for the very clean table and utensils.
author: Joanna L.

description: mmmmm...a belly full of ramen on a cold rainy day... After my icy wet road ride I wanted nothing else! My third SF spot to try out, Genki Ramen left me fully satisfied. They have a million options including tons of non-ramen things, at very fair prices and with a great atmosphere. Kind of modern/posh but not over the top. The Tonkatsu broth was great, not as rich or eggy as Izakaya Sozai but nearly as good (as good depending on what your in the mood for). The noodles were cooked to perfection.  And you can't go wrong on what's included because you can get or add anything! I chose Yasai, giving me delicious stir fried vegetables, definitely with a hint of yummy sesame, and added Wakame Seaweed and 1/2 Hard Boiled Egg (ditched the yolk). My mom had the Shichimi Chicken Salad which had wonderful grilled chicken and a tasty ginger dressing (and edamame) and the Nasu Gomaae we got was sweet and tender as well. Not as good as Dengaku, and Goma Ae is a little better with Spinach, but definitely still worth ordering.
author: Max H.

description: The guys at Genki really tried hard to make this a cool place, but it's really just the little details that don't really fit.  Whether it's the pictures in the menus that look a little dull or the staff that isn't so friendly, this place really isn't that cool.  Sure, they decked out the place with flat screen tv's and music, but that's no substitute for good food.  The ramen is alright, but nothing you can't find at any other noodle shop, as are their appetizers.  I will say that the drinks are pretty tasty, but when you add all these things up plus the difficulty of finding parking in the Richmond, Genki Ramen really isn't worth going out of your way for.
author: Tony L.

description: I came here with my bff.  The ramen is decent.  I liked the happy hour menu too.  It's not as good as hotei but conveniently in the richmond district.  We had the Takoyaki as an appetizer which was very different but delicious. Then I had the chicken karage ramen.  It wasn't anything special, but  I do like that they give you the chicken on a separate plate so it doesn't get soggy.  Its worth a try.
author: Joanne H.

description: For now, just three stars for the ramen. I got the chashu ramen with miso broth. It was pretty good. The noodles were a little tougher than I'd like and the broth was really strong. Also not that generous with the pork. For now I prefer Japantown ramen at Iroha. But I did see they have okonomiyaki here and I am for sure going to come back to try some!
author: Cathy T.

description: Greasy and salty bar food. Eat this stuff with sake or preferably when you're already fully loaded. Some tasty treats, pot-stickers, unagi fried rice and kimchee ramen. Funky decor and friendly attentive staff.
author: cora j.

description: We've ordered from here on delivery.com a couple of times and have been pretty happy! Definitely comfort food perfect after a weekend of too many cocktails. I like the ramen soup with shrimp and veggie tempura. They also have good gyozas. My husband loves the variety - he's had the Chicken Karaage, chicken wings, chicken nuggets, and asparagus wrapped in bacon. Good unique option for delivery versus the regular pizza/thai/indian/chinese options.
author: Sarah R.

description: I came here for their chicken karaage (it's an appetizer here instead of an entre) but it wasn't like the one Noriega Teriyaki House used to make. They have some interesting alcoholic drinks that were good. I'm impressed by the dcor and money they put in. There's about 8 Vizio LCD TVs and it has more of a trendy feel to it but the prices were fairly reasonable considering how much they invested. The Yakisoba and robatayki are good. I wouldn't order their gyoza. It comes out of the kitchen too watery since they boil it and don't pan fry it long enough. The next time I come here I have to try their ramen.
author: Armstrong B.

description: I had the ramen here the other day with a side of gyoza, as well as the fried seafood sampler platter.  Pretty solid for the price. Service could have been better, but was pretty decent for one person waiting on the entire place during lunch.  gotta check it out again for a more well rounded review.
author: Eric A.

description: I did not have high hopes when we decided to have dinner here.  I left without feeling anything b/c it was really just food that filled my stomach.  I had the chicken karrage ramen and the soup base was bland, but I heard the chashu ramen was better.  We ordered the gyoza and that was ok, but certainly not the best gyoza.  We also had the fried tofu and that was not much to say really, b/c it was not very memorable.  I don't think this place warrants a second visit as there are much better ramen houses in the city.
author: AhLin C.

description: Since I live in the Inner-Rich, I am inherently biased, and furthermore, since my ramen experiences extend little beyond Wagamama and the noodle place in the Emporium mall, I am not the strongest ramen noodle taster.  Nevertheless, four stars for Genki Ramen as a cheap, fun and local ramen-going experience with a solid if not unexceptional four page COLOR PHOTO menu of treats.  Agreed, the mixed drinks are kind of lame and an afterthought, but I just drink the beer anyway so whatever.  I mean, it's ramen, I'm not going to Burlingame or San Mateo for it, there are few things I would do that for anyway (one is Weimax, see review).
author: Aaron F.

description: I really like this place.  Atmosphere was good, the service was friendly and attentive.  We got two bowls of ramen, a squid side dish, and some chicken gizzard.  A bit too much for two, but it was my first time there so I wanted to try a few different things.  I have to admit that I liked everything we ordered.  I'm definitely going back.
author: John K.

description: This place has a huge menu! I was very into the beef - enoki rolls and the bacon wrapped asparagus (grilled on skewer). As far as the Robatayaki grilled stuff goes, it was all good. I had the salmon fillet, hamachi kama, scallops, and all 3 were very tasty. My friend didn't like the miso soup too much, but i enjoyed the clam broth soup very much. Okinomiyaki would probalbly be better to eat in the restaurant and not to go or via delivery. That has to be truly hot and fresh off the pan for best results. Delivery rocks, but the area served seems a bit small. Follow it up with a walk to Clement Street to the Genki Crepes joint and you are all set for the night.
author: Bobby G.

description:
the ramen is quite nice.

the decor is surprisingly nice. for a ramen house.

theres a bar. weird.

if youre hungry, pop in, eat a bowl.

its decent, but im not lighting off any flares.
author: Darrell L.

description: Not bad for a place I didnt expect much out of. Went here for a quick dinner before a night out and was satisfied. I ordered the Katsu curry and it was decent. Good spot to just have a quick bite.
author: Gordon L.

description: My wife and I went here for lunch on a whim and we're glad we did.  Our server was pleasant.  The food was served fairly quickly.  And more importantly, we enjoyed our appetizers and ramen!  This place is worth venturing into and the prices are reasonable.  Enjoy!
author: Arnel J.

description: Frozen industrial flavor croquettes, frozen veal cutlet passed off as tonkatsu. Chicken karaage was ok, but my eating companions disliked the KFC-quality of the breading. The ramen noodles themselves were not bad but definitely not homemade. The broth was made with canned stock doctored up with some miso, you could make better at home. The atmosphere was also not so great, tables full of teenagers or early 20s college kids playing strange table games that involved beating their fists on the table. Definitely rounded out the overall food-court quality of the experience. You're far better heading up Geary to some place like Suzu or Tanpopo.
author: BR E.

description: Delicious ramen...Nice decor...We will definitely come back again!  Spicy mabo tofu yay!
author: Pikachu P.

description: I just ate here after the stunning Warriors victory on Sunday (had to get that in there), and had a few beers in me.  I felt the need for some Ramen and had never tried this place before.  I ordered the Ma po tofu ramen which was decent, not spectacular. The tofu and soup was pretty good, but the noodles were only decent. I would go back though for the convenient location, but damn, could you open till like 3?? Oh and I ordered the soft shell crab salad. The dressing on the salad was bland,  but the crab was decent. Open later please!!!!
author: Tommy Y.

description:
this is a solid 3 star place. prices are a tad high, menu is a tad too good looking, and food is just a tad.. 3star.

i will totally come back here, and enjoy myself for that matter.  heck, any of my non-japanese food eating friends would really like this place.  great decor, lots of flat panel tv's and jpop music vid's.

as far as ramen is concerned, it's a solid 3 stars.
author: Ameer N.

description: Pretty decent noodles that filled me up for lunch. They have REAL ramen noodles.
author: Edgar G.

description: Mmmmmmm.  Imagine slurping tasty ramen while sitting in a West Elm catalog.  I am shocked it isn't rated higher, but if it keeps the lines down, I am all for it.  I am dying to try their okonomiyaki -- haven't seen it on a lot of local japanese menus.  They also carry a lot of Korean-Japanese fusion dishes that look interesting.
author: Tim G.

description: The ramen noodles are pretty good and the soup base as well. I like the spice mabo ramen. The lunch menu is a pretty good deal. If you miss it, you can at least get the 3-7pm happy hour appetizers and the $3 beer. The chicken karage appetizer is not greasy nor dry. I usually get it as one of my happy hour appetizers. Parking can be a bit of a pain but what part of SF isn't?
author: Gilbert D.

description:
We've been to Genki Ramen 5 to 6 times and love their noodles!  We have tried the cha-shu, kimchi, seafood, nori, spicy tofu, and the beef stew. Our favorites are definitely the cha-shu and beef stew ramen.

Ooooh...  Just thinking about the rich broth is making my mouth water.  Yum.  We have been telling all of our friends to go check it out.
author: M H.

description: walking by and thought we tried out the happy hour menu. pretty decent price for the food and drink and good service
author: mister f.

description: Happened to be in the neighborhood and looked this place up. The wait staff were helpful in choosing from a bunch of tasty ramen options. The noodles were good. Not the best ever, but definitely good. The broths were really nice. Overall a great spot I'd go back to.
author: Ido M.

description:
i love ramen.  and i love delivery.  genki ramen makes me happy.

i get home late and lazy.  genki ramen is usually the first on our list of take out options.  the service is fast and having good ramen delivered to your door is pretty amazing.  you can pick and choose "additions", including fried tofu- my favorite.  highly recommend if you're looking to dine in... (can't speak much to the restaurant).
author: tamiko d.

description: My friend introduced me to this place recently - and being a ramen fan it is great to have a little more choices in SF other than Suzu noodle in Japantown that has long wait time and a little pricey.  The ramen I got with chicken karage was quite good at Genki.   Price is reasonable and the only tough part is getting the attention of the waiter/waitresses.  We had to wait quite a long time to order.  Other than this, I look forward to coming here again. :-)
author: S J.

description: i didnt like the kimchi ramen...the cabbage tasted like it had been around for awhile..chewy. i usually get their bbq pork ramen. their ramen is pretty mediocre. definitely better places to go for ramen.
author: Helen L.

description:
the vegetarian ramen was filled with stir fried veggies, and not bad at all! i would go back. it's as good as any ramen you'll get in j-town.

really slick interior in here, but the j-pop videos played on the flat screens have GOT TO GO.
author: Lisa M.

description: Oh how I love ramen!!  Genki is a good ramen spot, but it isn't the best.  I was in love with Genki the first time I tried it, but after eating it last night, I have to say I wasn't impressed at all.  I was actually disappointed.  I just returned from WMC in Miami where I ate one meal a day for a week.  I was really looking forward to this meal., and I was let down.  Although I know this is bad, I am a salt lover.  However the ramen is was so salty I almost couldn't eat it.  That says something to me.  I recommend Genki for when you are hungover, other wise I would definitely try other spots.
author: Samantha R.

description:
Ramen is good....other noodle and rice plates are good too.

A cute little place...very worth trying.
author: Lan L.

description:
good solid bowl of ramen.  there's quite a bit of selection in terms of variety of different bowls, some of which are pretty damn unique.  

also, get the asparagus wrapped in bacon.  it's not a big skewer, but it's pretty damn good.
author: Jason J.

description:
Not the best , but very pleasant. We had ramen and gyoza combo, the yakisoba with pepppered beef, and the beef teriyaki served with rice. All very tasty.
Great service. The food came pretty fast after we ordered, and the waiters were attentive.
Definitely will come back......Strret parking is not easy though.
author: lovetoeat a.

description: Ramen is good.  Best of all, they are open late.
author: Richard L.

description: This place is great! The food is excellent (I  recommend the yakisoba) and the prices are very reasonable (especially when you look at the outstaqnding decor and clean atmosphere of this p[lace compared to some of the other nearby restaurants.
author: Greenman A.

description: Table for 5. The wait for our appetizers took extremely long. Ordered the fried seafood platter that was tiny. There was only one spring roll, cut into two, two pieces of oysters, and maybe 5 or 6 squid legs.  The seafood was in a lot of batter.  I would not try that dish again.  We also ordered the samurai wings.  There was a misunderstanding and we thought there would be more wings to the dish.  The waiter told us that we usually get 5 wings but since they were bigger today, they gave us 4. First I thought .. there are some inconsistencies with that and secondly there are 5 of us .. I'd rather have smaller ones so all of us can have some rather than have one person miss out because they are bigger.  Aside from quantity, the taste of the wings were the highlight of my meal, sadly.  We got our appetizers at the same time as our entrees.  I had the curry chicken katsu ramen.  The chicken was decent, but by the time I finished eating my appetizer the fried crust on the chicken was all soggy.  The ramen itself was okay.  The portion was big, I ate 75% of it before I got too full.
author: Jen P.

description: I do love coming to this place, I used to come after work by myself quite a few times.  It used to be my favorite ramen place.  Then I became obsessed with Ramen and tried basically all the good places around the bay area and some in Socal.  I still love the Ramen here.  I like their chashu ramen, good leaner pieces of chashu still with flavorful fat attached, delicious broth and the ramen and broth are delicious.  Their chicken karaage ramen is delicious too.  The atmosphere is comfortable and decor is nice.  Staff is attentive and friendly.  I need to return here sometime soon.  I wish I could make their Happy Hour more, where you can buy chicken karaage or the pork fried rice for $2 before a certain time, like 3 or 4pm I think.
author: John L.

description: short stretch down geary boulevard...gary or gee'ry?...the great debate...moving on...genki ramen the destination...ramen soup, yakisoba ramen stir-fry, ramen over okonomiyaki pancake, robatayaki skewers and donburi rice bowls...quite the extensive big portioned menu selection...self rule...typically a large menu, a bad omen...but, finding a surprise in meaty ramen choice...tonkatsu and curry tonkatsu base?...and standard miso base, but no salt....standard and fine ramen...tonkatsu broth a mild tonkatsu sauce flavor....miso broth also mild, and less rich or salty...acceptable big ramen bowls....next, the saucy okonomiyaki pancake...crisp and chicken inside...saucy mayo and tonkatsu saucing all above with plenty of fish flakes..a saucy override and overflowing mayo and sauce....overall tasty and good cooking pancakes....last, finishing yakisoba with kimchi, bacon and spicy sausage...nice browned noodle dining...tasty sausage and plenty of kimchi and pork....good grubbin' heavy seasoning and hot iron plattered dining....genki ramen great for casual group with diverse mixed needs...
author: Hen A.

description: This place gets 1 star for the architecture, its... interesting and a very funky, cool way. Theres another star for the like 8 plasma screens scattered about so that no matter where you sit, you have a great view of the freakin crazy J-pop dvd on repeat. Then I saw the kitchen, its glassed in, and gives a really cool effect. I approve. Extra star. What? this place has food you say? Really? Almost forgot about that. Food was ... aight. nothing special. Not bad, but not worth 10 bucks a plate. (good thing it wasnt 10 bucks a plate for lunch! w00t for that).
author: Eric P.

description:
Ok, another ramen review for me.  The thing about Ramen is that when you find one thats really good, you find yourself thinking about it often - craving the taste.  Go to popular ramen places and you'll find people waiting outside to get in.  
I've been to Genki Ramen twice.  I can't recall what their ramen tastes like but I did like their chicken cartilage appetizer.  I never thought I'd ever like this part I usually throw away, but my wife got me into appreciating these new "textures"  
I'm sure others before me have already mentioned the TV sets.  That seems to be a common addition to Japanese places recently.   As expected, they had Iron chef showing one time but I think nowadays they show more J-pop videos.   I don't like J-pop, but my uncle's younger brother was actually a challenger chef on one of the early Iron Chefs in 1994.  The main theme was Anago which he lost.  He has a nice restaurant now in Kobe.

Update:  I just reduced my rating to 1 star.  We haven't been back ever since our last visit.  Even though its close, and we love Ramen, I guess they just didn't produce anything worth coming back for.

Update2:  Guess what - I did come back.  I ordered the ramen set with small fried rice.  They gave me a ramen with large order fried rice.  The fried rice costs as much as the ramen and was way too much!  They shouldn't assume I want to eat all that food because I don't order using the exact menu phrases.

Update #3:  OK, I give it 2 stars since I appear to be coming back about once a year.  Its still not what I would consider true ramen but good enough for annual visits so I've shown that I'm at least not avoiding their ramen.  My new complaint is now the MUSIC.  Please choose a more noodle-friendly genre or turn the boomboom tunes DOWN!
author: J M.

description:
I love ramen. I just wish I didn't have to drive out all the way to San Mateo for Santa or Mountain View for Ryowa Ramen. Since Genki Ramen is on Geary and is relatively close, I'd thought I'd give it shot for those times I need a quick ramen fix.

Unfortunately, Genki Ramen is not the answer. I got the cold ramen, which to be fair may not be the best way to judge the quality of ramen. However the noodles were soggy, the chashu was way too salty, and the sesame dressing, which isn't really the standard sauce that I am use to accompanying cold ramen, was pretty flavorless. I think the main problem with the sesame sauce was that since it was more like a thick dressing, the water from the noodles and other ingredients just diluted the flavor.

My other friends got the soup ramen. One chashu and one katsu curry. They did not look appetizing either.

I must admit the decor was modern and sleek. The restaurant was spotless and the LCD TVs on the wall fit well with the restaurant.

Unfortunately, Genki Ramen falls way short on its ramen, which doesn't bode well for a ramen restaurant.
author: Jeff K.

description: Not my best ramen experience...the decor is trendy--lots of nice wood and stone, mixed in with huge flat screen TVs in all directions.  The food was okay--nothing to write home about but not bad.  The noodles were all right, the fixins were fine, but the broth was really lacking in depth.  This place is no Santa.  The service, though, was really not good.  The poor waitress was handling about 10 tables on her own and was really swamped.  We could see two guys in the kitchen but neither ever helped her out.   Our food came fairly quickly, but that was the last we saw of the waitress.  No refills on tea, no checking to make sure things were fine, and we had to practically grab her to ask for the check (which it took 10 more minutes to get).  The goofy antics on Japanese TV were fun at first, but as we waited longer and longer to pay they just became annoying.  I'd pass this one up.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I tried this place out with a couple friends, and I have to say I am impressed. They've got a large selection of different ramen and other food. Tried the spicy tofu ramen+karaage and an order of their "sumo" okonomiyaki (bacon+cheddar cheese) and was pleased with both. Food came out pretty fast and the waitress working was very nice. The only gripes I have with this place is that all the parking around is meter and the prices are a little more than what I would expect. Overall, great resteraunt if you wanna spend a little extra than other places.
author: Danny K.

description: I had their Chashu ramen (pork based broth, pork slices, green onion, egg, bamboo shoots, and noodles). The noodles were well done, the pork soft and delicious, and the broth quite hearty. They have multiple flat screen TVs that were showing various sporting events. The lighting was a bit too dark for my taste, but wasn't horrible.  Looks like they have good happy hour specials. Service was quick and courteous. I would recommend this place for a good hearty ramen.
author: Alp M.

description: Its soooooo good and it does not take a long time to get the food!!!!
author: Sophia v.

description: Not sure if I will come back here in the foreseeable future. My friend and I did not get served food (not even apps) while three different groups who arrived 5-10 minutes after us were served their food. The waitresses did not seem to notice that we were not served any food at all. We ended up leaving after 40-45 minutes. The only reason why I gave two stars instead of one is because I had two above-average experiences here prior to this one. Honestly speaking, if this review was one star, I will likely never come back here.
author: Gerry L.

description: Very good food, fast, reasonably priced, and attentative wait staff. Love all the soups and the grilled onigiri.
author: A L.

description: I love this place! They have a good happy hour with a few appetizers and drinks on the menu. I come here pretty often for a late lunch and the place is pretty empty so we get excellent service from the waitresses. The food here is soooo good; I can't think of a better place to get ramen, yakitori, okonomiyaki, and yakisoba! I loooooove the kinoko mushroom ramen and pretty much get it almost every time I'm here! It's that good! Definitely a place you gotta try at least once, whether you like ramen or not! Oh, and no, ramen here is not the same as the kind where you open the package and boil for 3 minutes :)
author: Ellie Y.

description: Went on a Sunday with some friends and boyfriend for dinner. I ordered their cold veggie noodle thing without soup and it was disgusting! Everyone elses food was delicious, so just don't order the cold veggie thing without soup! ick!
author: Angel K.

description: Lunch on a weekday with family.  The menu offers a lot of variety.  All our dishes were delicious.  Definitely would go back when in the area.
author: Jerome O.

description: Ramen is good. I like getting it with karaage chicken. I like the sides that they have too like Gyozo and fried rice. Service is good. My son and I like watching the Japanese music videos on the plasma tvs on the walls.
author: Roger C.

description: This is actually a pretty good place for fast-food ramen.  Not only do they deliver, but they're fast.  Their selection is pretty decent.
author: mardou o.

description: Great place to go if you want to satisfy a ramen craving. I've had the chicken katsu curry ramen and the veggie curry ramen. Both were great. Go with an appetite as the servings are huge. Service is fast and the food is served almost immediately. Both the food and the drinks are inexpensive.
author: Sierra d.

description: Excellent ramen noodles with great extra garnish choices such as spinach and corn.  However, shrimp tempura was too oily.  The oil wasn't stale, but too much stayed in the food, which usually indicates they're not getting the cooking oil hot enough in the kitchen, which shouldn't happen at a place like this.
author: George C.

description: This place is really pretty good. I've never actually been to the restaurant, but their delivery has been pretty reliable. The phone staff is a little little lacking in customer service, but the orders always turn out right. You gotta respect anywhere that delivers korroke. I also really love their beef yakisoba and their curry chicken katsu.
author: Adam L.

description: ramen is always good and filling. i love their salmon fried rice and tempura unagi and pumpkin. delicous and delicious.
author: A L.

description: Delicious tempura!  Priced quite reasonably, and the interior is super cute   It's nice to find a place that specializes in non-sushi Japanese food.  The little side salad was a little watery though, and I do like my little salad.
author: Geraldine S.

description: When my Hapa friend says he wants comfort food, he means the Japanese variety that comes in a bowl. We started with a plate of simple edamame, which was delivered piping hot and with the perfect amount of salt. "This is a good sign," says my friend, "a very good sign." We both selected our individual bowls of ramen and waited in silent anticipation. Banana Yoshimoto once described a bowl of ramen in one of her novels so beautifully, that I thought I would have to travel the the Japanese countryside to ever experience such culinary magic. Not so. I only have to go as far as 4th and Geary. The ingredients were fresh, the noodles chewy, the broth was the perfect temperature and the spices perfectly balanced. With every delicious bite, you could literally feel the restorative power of the traditional soup. I was only halfway through my bowl when I looked across the table at my very critical friend's bowl which was now empty. "I told you I had a good feeling about this place," he says, looking happy and satisfied.
author: Gillian H.

description: YUM YUM!! I ordered the Garlic Tenderous Rib ramen. The meat was flavorful & tender, noodle was al dente and soup was perfect.
author: Jane W.

description: Genki Ramen has been my go-to ramen place for about a year now, and I am loving it! I used to go to this other place in J Town but the wait is always ridiculous. At Genki, I've rarely had to wait for a table and the waitresses there wait on your hand and foot. My husband and I have our favorites there, so we're never disappointed. If you like spicy, go for their Mabo Tofu Ramen. It's delicious! My husband gets the Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen and on the few times I've gotten to try it, the broth is sooooo tasty! The location is a bit out of the way (we live on the other side of the city) but every time we're in the area, we're sure to stop by. What's not to like? Cheap, delicious ramen, TVs showing the Giants game and waitresses providing awesome service is definitely worth four stars.
author: Chelsea H.

description: the chicken karage ramen is quite good!
author: Christopher L.

description: I don't know why people like coming here.  The food is only mediocre and there's only street parking.  The ramen tastes more like Chinese stir fry in broth.  If you think this place is good then you must think that the ramen places in Japan town are amazing.  When my hubby and I came here the place was full - mainly with families and young children.  After we got a table the server took our order.  We asked her to repeat our order but since she was so busy she said that she "got it."  As 50 minutes passed by we asked for our order to every server.  Each server answered with "wait a minute" and never came back to check on us.  When the food finally came the order was completely wrong.  We got one bowl of ramen between the two of us and one soda.  We tried to get the attention from the server to ask her about the rest of our order, but she answered again, "wait a mintue."  If the servers have no time to attend to the seated tables - then guess what - stop seating more guests!  We finished the bowl together, paid the bill and left no tip.  The servers didn't even notice that we left.  Will never come here again.
author: shirley h.

description: I would really only go here for the ramen - the few times I've sampled other dishes, I wasn't too excited.  I have to say, I've never been to Santa Ramen and I'm no ramen connoisseur, but I have been to a handle of other ramen houses, and I like Genki.  The tonkatsu soup base is a little different for me, but I like the richness of it.  Also, I think the chasu is much more flavorful than other places I've tried, and the portions are decent.  Also, I like that you can change the firmness of your noodles (apparently, I like my ramen a little firmer than most).  Gyoza and chicken karaage are good, though I remember the gyoza sauce is a little different.  Also, love the candy they gave at the end of the meal.  Actually made me go to the Genki store to get my own bag!  Talk about good advertising!  I've been lucky, I guess - no real problems with service, and I like that they're open relatively late.
author: Joyce L.

description: this place is pretty good for ramen in the city. havent really been to one in the city that i liked besides here. the decor is nice with plenty of flat screen  for your viewing pleasure. curry ramen....YUMMMMM....
author: Tuan D.

description: agree with other reviewers.  decent ramen, although a bit salty, and oily, not quite traditional.  may be pork instead of fish broth based.  Very nice decor and LCDs on the walls is nice.  large selection.  will try other things next time.
author: Dd d.

description: This place is the bomb! This place got some GOOD-ASS vegetarian dish(even tough theres only a few to choose from). My boy ordered some kinda mint cocktail and that was pretty good too. 5 stars fo sho.
author: Jon K.

description:
ramen is my favorite restaurant food, when i lived in the richmond, this was my place, but then i moved away and tried to find another ramen place

went to hotaru near chinatown, hotei in sunset, ryowa in berkeley and mountain view, maru ichi in mountain view, and santa in san mateo. genki is still #1

every ramen is good. i like the curry ramens a lot. staff is super nice, food comes out quick. i wish i could go here everyday
author: Ashley H.

description: i am shocked that genki only got 3 stars, i am full japanese, and need asain food every week... so that being said... i loved the huge blue sake and lychee cocktail- the fried rice was really good, made to order, i hate veggies... and everything was super reasonable. i plan on going back twice a month atleast. its pretty cute in there and there were loads of other asian, like FOB kids in there, so you know its gotta be some kind of good.
author: Sydel S.

description: not bad. it's hard to find a good ramen place in the city, but this one is pretty good. good menu selections. i would go back
author: Yinnie Q.

description: i like their seafood ramen.  you can watch tv while eating.  (just like home)
author: con c.

description:
i don't know how authentic this japanese food is, but it is sure yummy! nice decor, funny japanese stuff playing on the TVs, and delish food! pictures of everything on the menu (including a can of soda - ha!) are quite helpful. 
the okonomiyake was delicious!
green tea ice cream dessert rounded the meal out perfectly! 
yum yum!
author: erica r.

description: Less crappy videos on the screen. Food is decent for the price.  My friend dumped an oyster shell into my tea for saying Younha is a man.
author: Matthew G.

description: Good ramen, with a nice diverse ramen menu.  The staff is also very nice.
author: Mike R.

description: I was in Japan for three weeks in 2004, and that was when I developed a major ramen addiction.  Prior to visiting Genki Ramen, I liked to get my noodle fix at Hotei in Sunset.  At Genki, I enjoyed the Yasai Ramen (topped with lots of vegetables), and my husband had the traditional Chashu Ramen.  We were both very happy with our food and felt as though we'd traveled back to Tokyo.  The service was also outstanding, and the fact that we could see the cooks preparing our food was an added bonus.  We can't wait to go to Genki Ramen again!
author: Babs J.

description: Tried this place tonight, it's in my old hood, the Richmond D...nice place, chic decor (in the Aves at least!). I had the Chashu Ramen and an Asahi. Was tempted to try their soju mojitos but my day called for a brew...we also had the 'Chicken Gristle', sounds nastier than it was; fried lumps of chicken with, yep, gristle in the middle. Not too bad but I did not chew all the tough parts. The ramen was good, fair I would say. "Suzu" in J Town still rules that in my mind. Flat screen TVs all over the place, not sure how I feel about that. On the one hand I f*cking LOVE tv, but then again, while sharing a meal it's not the best thing to have around...
author: Steve K.

description: I have no idea what happened to this place.  Sure it was never authentic but it was decent tasting - in the beginning at least.  I ate there about a month ago and EVERYTHING has changed.  The food quality was terrible.  I had the cha shu ramen and I can only hope that this restaurant will return to its former self when it first opened.  The broth was watered down and the noodles were limp and soggy.  I'm so disappointed and won't be returning.
author: Remus L.

description: It smells a little sometimes, but damn this place is tasty.
author: John D.

description: food is blend and not tasty in any degree even for a Chinese ramen joint.  the noodle is hard instant noodle like.  the okonomiyaki is mushy and tasteless (except the large amount of teriyaki sauce on top of it).  only good thing is the price is not very high.
author: Gary T.

description: This place could definately do better. The first time I went there I was served a tiny portion of ramen that lacked in any flavor and had a giant bug floating in the soup. I figured that since they did not give me too much of a hassle for asking for a refund I would try them again sometime down the line-big mistake. The second time I was there I was seated and had to go get my own menu after figuring out that no one there was going to help me. I ordered an appetizer and ramen for dinner. They served me the ramen first and when I reminded them that I had ordered gyoza they said it would just take a moment. They had the nerve to try and serve me the gyoza AFTER I was done eating and had asked already for my tab. The servers are totally lacking in common sense and the food is unremarkable compared to other places in the area.
author: preston m.

description: my brother & i went here to eat. everything was good! i still love their ramen. still taste the same. i loved the chocolate fondue. maybe because i never had it anywhere else. overall. loved it here! will come back again & again!(:
author: Jenny H.

description: Decent though not outstanding ramen.  Kind of an odd interior with a club like feel.  Looked at the few flatscreens though never actually watched any of it.  For some reason, I always feel like i should be sipping on a mixed drink and bopping my head to some cheesy techno.
author: Tom L.

description: I like this place, not a big fan, but I like this place. I usually come here whenever it's late and I have no where else that I want to eat. Their decor inside is nice, they have some cool chairs and some nice menus. The walls are aligned with televisions that are really interesting when wanting to eat your food and watching t.v. Haha. The food here is okay, I don't believe they make their own noodles unlike Watami. Too bad they didn't, but if they did I think this place would be a great hit. Usually I get the ramen noodles because they are oh so yummy! Ha. My favorite has to be the curry veggies. yum. I'm trying to eat healthier nowadays so I'm going more of the veggies thing. Thats a great choice if you're wanting to be a veggietarian. Overall this place is really good if you want a late night thang. Also the parking here is sucky... like how geary always is. But anyways, come here if you want some alright tasting ramen for some nice prices. Opens 'till 1! (on fridays and saturdays.)
author: Johnny T.

description: As said before, the pictures are not that accurate. Gyoza is good, Chicken Karaage and the fried rice all complimented the main bowl very well. Though the lunch combo special is only two pieces of your choice of appetizer, you get what you pay for. $71 + tip for 5 of us. Good service and trendy decor.
author: Brad Q.

description: cold ramen is a must try....i also like their potstickers as well...where else can u have some japanese food at 1 am in the morning and watch japanese shows ...go to genki ramen!
author: stephanie n.

description: Genki Ramen is selling the atmosphere more than the quality of the food. The food is ok. If you want to hang out with friends and have a cocktail, Genki Ramen will do the trick. They have multiple TV hung up on the walls and they play Japanese or Korean music videos. The value of the food is a little over priced and the quality of the food is acceptable but if you just want some place to hang out and chat, Genki Ramen may fit the purpose.
author: Liana C.

description: genki ramen, how do i love thee? let me count the ways... let me first say that those of you who may complain about authenticity and blah blah blah, guess what? this shiz just tastes good. it's salt soup and there ain't nothin better than that. i defy you to try the tenderous rib and tell me it's anything less than braised meat perfection. my friends and i always have a yummy time here.
author: Jennifer M.

description: my best friend an i went here cause its around the corner form his house. it was cold so we wanted soup so we thought we would give it a try. we tried the tempura with ramen and a yakisoba i believe it was. the ramen was nasty it had seaweed in it so the soup tasted like the sea. but dotn get me wrong i love seaweed but this tasted weird. the yakisoba didnt have much taste and it was super greasy. i do not think i would ever come back here again. we should have just gotten pho down the street.
author: Linda L.

description: mMmmMMm! nice and persistent service. food was very sizzling hot and literally got burnt a few times. good food and i'm liking their deal, 3-7pm appetizers and drinks are only 3$! drOools! their interoir looks nice. even their chair has the word "genki." i will be back!
author: Valerie N.

description: i went there couple time...my impression is not bad. i love ramen...their ramen is pretty good, but might not be the tranditional japanese ramen. but so far so good~ my bf said he wanna go back for sure.
author: B B.

description: price is very reasonable.  service is below average because the waitress seemed lost and i had to ask another waitress to refill the tea pot.  the ramen was average, nothing spetacular, ramen is ramen.  however, the fried rice was exceptional.  concerning the wait for the food, it's below average.  since it's ramen, i expected the preparation time to be minimal.  however, we did have a party of 14 so giving a rating of average is reasonable.  i wouldn't drive all the way to SF from sJ just for ramen, but if you're in the area, give it a try.
author: Wailun Eugene W.

description: Ordered Genki Ramen through grubhub. I had never set foot inside Genki Ramen so I can't comment on decor. But I can comment on their small portions. We had ordered yakitori for delivery and was very shocked at little food was actually delivered. We couldn't decide whether to order more food from another restaurant that night or what. Overall, it was disappointing. If you like Yakitori like I do, try Hana Zen near union square.
author: Chanli S.

description: The food is OK, nothing special.  The service is SLOW...we had to wait 45 minutes to get our food.  They even forgot 2 orders!  When we asked for ice water, the waitress asked how many.  We said for everyone (which is like 10 people), she started counting and came up with the number 4.  She only brought 4 cups, and I've asked her if she can bring more ice water for everyone and she brought me one cup.  We had to ask her for the 3rd time and she finally brought EVERYONE ice water.  The food pricing is decent.  Overall, it's Ok.
author: Linda H.

description: i've ordered delivery take out here a few times and it's always great!  my favorites are the soft shell crab (they give you alot) the unagi & veggie tempura, & veggie goza are yummy as well.  the yakisoba is really good as well either veggie or seafood.  =)  YUM!  also their okonomiyaki: seafood & veggie are good.  their ramen is just okay, but when it's a COLD night in SF it's always good to cuddle up with a warm bowl of ramen!  comfort food!
author: laura k.

description: Good ramen.  Nothing special.  Plenty of selection and plenty of entertainment-lots of TVs everywhere and the service is good.
author: kenny l.

description: Not bad, the ramen was pretty standard. I've had tastier pork slices, the "chicken nugget" was surprisingly delicious. Service is as expected for a ramen place.
author: Henry T.

description: good, quick service, good proportions, mellow area, dont pressure you with the check unless you ask for it (they must believe its rude). -1 star goes to parking. its a no no no no no.
author: Nicholas D.
